Reviews.Title: “Very Busy Trip To Toronto”
Reviews.Author: larn796
Reviews.Content: Since Toronto is only 2 hours by train from my home, it is a frequent destination. Since one of the main purposes of this trip was to see the Mayan exhibit at the ROM, I chose this hotel, which is directly across the street. I booked two rooms, requesting early check-in. We arrived at 9am and had breakfast in the dining room. Unfortunately this was the only dissapointment of our stay. The quality of the food was sorely lacking considering the prices. Our check-n was uneventful and the front desk was very efficient and helpful. The property is very attractive with lots of wood trim. The room was spacious and up to date except for an older television. You don't see tube televisions anymore, even in budget accommodations and the InterContinental certainly would not be considered low rent. Our rooms, on the inner courtyard were very clean and quiet. The location of this property is very close to the subway and taxis are always waiting outside. The theater district is only 10 minutes away by cab. The Yorkville district is full of very good eateries and upscale shopping. I would be willing to book this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION...THAT'S ALL ABOUT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: EVALEXIA
Reviews.Content: Good location,two steps away from ROM(Royal Ontario Museum),10 min drive(if you're lucky) to CN Tower.Staff a bit rude and unfriendly,my friend(which is canadian and an old client) was very dissapointed by the way they were treating us!Our room was small and very noisy!And difficult to park around this hotel...Location,in the heart of Toronto,is everything that I found perfect here.No,I will not return at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Must try!”
Reviews.Author: KelleyE403
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by the top-notch service offered at this lovely downtown hotel. We pulled up in front, having asked in advance about valet parking, and an attendant arrived immediately to assist us. We then checked in where the most pleasant young lady took care of us. When it came time to leave the next morning, we had been forewarned about the St.Patrick's Day Parade, and to expect delays. In spite of this warning, our car was waiting for us out front, and we had no problem getting away. I can't wait to come back here! Excellent value, excellent experience, excellent accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: brianS1
Reviews.Content: This well located boutique hotel offers the best value in the best location. We've been staying here for years. The rooms are spacious, with great beds and sheets.The staff is over the top friendly, professional, and helpful. Ask about the Ambassador deal. It's really a good one. The lobby is a feel good. Great gym. The location is perfect, as everything from wonderful restaurants to the best shopping is a short distance away. This place is the gem of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vikasm123
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business for three days. Was comfortable and staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Medical Transport Saviors”
Reviews.Author: Sheree B
Reviews.Content: We assisted an international transport of 3 premature babies and all went well until we landed. After being up all night (and experiencing the amazing Sick Children's Hospital with one of the babies), we checked in (about 12 hrs late) at 6 AM, with nothing but the scrubs we were wearing and our stethoscopes. I'm sure we looked horrible and the first thing I said was "we don't even have toothbrushes!" (our suitcase was left in the transport car in our haste to call an ambulance). Josie was at the desk. She not only got us toothbrushes but when she heard we hadn't eaten since noon the day before she made sure our room service order was there in 15 minutes. We thankfully ate and fell into bed. Great bed and perfect pillows! Loved the scent of the soap and lotion. To describe all the emergencies that happened during the next 3 days and the help we received from the staff would take a novel to write. I wish we knew all of the names but we can only personally thank Josie and Rolf. You will never know what you did for us by being so kind and how it helped a wonderful local family. The room service food is fabulous. (We ordered the caesar salad with shrimp and a pizza 3 times!) We actually did end up with about 12 hrs to see the 4 sites we were hoping to see and because of the PRIME location we did it all. The Royal Ontario Museum, The Bata Shoe Museum, dinner at the CN Tower, a lychee martini at Hemingway's and Kensington Market! We hope to go back someday and we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Thank you so much, Sheree Brekke RN & Tobias Brekke NICU RN

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a very good Interconti”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: When I lived in Toronto, there was a dearth of good hotels in the University district. This has changed with a number of first class properties. I chose the Interconti as I usually have good luck with that chain and this one was not exception. The staff was warm and welcoming, my room well laid out and comfortable. The only strange thing was that there was no desk lamp. I called down for help and it was quite a while before anyone arrived. In the meantime, I had move one of the bedside lamps over to the desk and started working. The engineer was not much help - just stated that there should have been a lamp on the desk and then left!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool/Great location”
Reviews.Author: CMT-JWT
Reviews.Content: Close to museums, galleries, shopping (if you must) and clean, safe subway, this is a reasonable sized IC property with a wonderful lap pool in a glassed in roof. Quality restaurant with overall excellent service. Enjoy Toronto from here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: Great location in Yorkville for museums, upscale restaurants, Celeb watching etc. Typical IC but rooms seem a little small. Lap pool only. No Club lounge unfortunately. Rooms and all areas very clean. Good restaurant onsite

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: David_DiBattista
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville many times now and I love it. This is a high end hotel with everything you would expect find in such a place. The location is tremendous, right across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum, and the staff are uniformly friendly, courteous, and helpful. The only negative thing I can think of to say is that I wish they would provide free internet; this is an amenity that is common in most hotels these days, even at lower end places such as the Knight's Inn. Nevertheless, the next time I stay in Toronto, it will be at the Intercontinental in Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “Just as nice as Park Hyatt for less money. I will stay again in a few months next time I go to Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: Firehawk70
Reviews.Content: My mom has been raving about Intercontinental hotels for years and I never pay it much attention. Well now I will. This hotel was really nice and for the price, quite nicer than the Park Hyatt which was my mainstay in Toronto for years. If money was no object I still might choose a higher-end room at the Park, but it is for me and over 35% less is a lot. The difference paid for our very nice dinner in Yorkville. I was a bit lucky that they upgraded our Deluxe King to a 6th floor mini-suite with a perfect view of the Royal Ontario Museum The only single thing that I think you get at the Park Hyatt that's worth it for a romantic stay is a bigger marble-lined tub that easily holds two. These tubs were just plain ceramic and same as you'd have at home. But I guess it's dinner or a bath!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed messages...”
Reviews.Author: Duncan T
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, quiet, friendly staff. Location right on for the purpose of my trip. However, 4 things I didn't appreciate. First, the dining room was closed that evening. This after them sending me a reservation reminder with 10% off dinner in the dining room. Second, the charge of $4 for 30 minutes of internet. Very Mickey Mouse...is this the flagship brand of ICHotelsGroup, or Motel 6? Ironically, there's another one of their hotels down the street, the Holiday Inn, with free internet. They're way behind the market....internet is now a utility....kinda like charging for toilet paper. Thirdly, on top of the delivery charge, the 15% gratuity automatically added to the room service bill. I take offense to someone telling me what I think of their service. The big loser here is the staff, as I always tip at least 20% for "average" service. And fourth, the $1.50 charge for local calls, including 800 numbers. Again,very Mickey Mouse. They have to decide what market segment they want to compete in...if it's top tier like the Windsor Arms or Four Seasons nearby, then raise the rates and stop nickel-and-diming the customer. Personally, next time I would stay at the Holiday Inn at half the price. There I get free internet, free local calls, and I get to decide how much I want to tip for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or a couple's getaway”
Reviews.Author: Curt99
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times, and the experience has been predictably good. Positives: - large rooms - Nearby restaurants, - the Royal Ontario Museum - near the University of Toronto - good pool for swimming lengths - good (but pricey) martinis in the bar - generally quiet rooms - bathrobes - large flat-screen TV - soaker tub and separate shower - large desks - very clean - excellent bath amenities Negatives - expensive internet access - lousy chair for working at the desk - pillows too high and hard for my taste

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior58_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend. Right across the street from the ROM and walking distance to mega shopping. Very comfortable, clean and relaxing. Great lap pool and gym on the 8th floor. Easy access to subway lines. Pay per use for wi-fi is a rip off. Didn't think hotels did that any more. Parking is in the municipal lot in back which has underground access to hotel. Enjoyed the stay and would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Joint”
Reviews.Author: Smalldeluxe
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times and always found the rooms comfortable. Attended the on-site restaurant for private events and for breakfast and found the service, food and setting to be perfect. The location of this hotel is ideal for shopping and site seeing. Bonus... Across the street from the ROM and on the subway line. One complaint - wifi cost are insane!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: macstav
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this Intercontinental when I am in Toronto on business. The location is great, it close to my head office for meetings and it's close to great restaurants and shopping when I'm not. The staff are great - helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable business trip”
Reviews.Author: jc72
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week working in Toronto, where I stayed at the Intercontinental on Bloor Street West. Don't have a strong view on the value for money , as my company paid for the stay! My double room cost about Â£200 (C$300) per night for bed and breakfast - slightly less at the weekend. The main room was a good size, with a large double bed, sofa and chair around a coffee table, and another chair by a writing desk. I had a front facing room (735) with a view of the museum over the road, and a more distant view of the CN tower. The bathroom had a shower cubicle and separate bath, which was a definite plus - plenty of towels and toiletries, with a wide mirror behind the bathroom sink. There was also a full length mirror in the wardrobe door. Ample wardrobe and cupboard space for clothes. Amenities - large flat screen TV with about 40 channels (BBC world, a few US, and lots of local and national Canadian). Hairdryer (which I didn't use so no idea how good it was). Iron and ironing board (ditto). Mini bar and coffer maker (ditto) Small in-room safe (which I did use and is a must for any hotel to be honest). I slept fine, the bed was very comfortable. I could hear a little traffic noise - not an issue for me, but could be an issue for a very light sleeper. Hotel is conveniently located for upmarket shopping. Also a 2-3 minute walk to St George subway station (direct link to Union Station). Handy Hint - first time I went to St George, I got a week pass for the subway which cost about Â£25 and which saved the hassle of buying a ticket every trip. Breakfast options included with my meal were substantial (e.g. "The Canadian" - tea or coffee, toast, fruit juice, small plate of fresh fruit, bacon or sausage served with eggs and fried potatoes). Enough to set me up for the day! Service was very good - friendly staff generally, who provided information about local bars and shops, called taxis, stored luggage while I explored Toronto on my last day. A nifty idea they have is a PC in the lobby on which you can check in online- if you then need to print a boarding pass, the PC is linked to a printer at the reception desk. Looking round Toronto, I went to an ice hockey game at the Air Canada Centre (fun experience, and easy to get to from Union Station), I went to the Ice Hockey Hall of Fame (vast amount of memorabilia, heaven for the ice hockey fan but mostly lost on me), and the CN tower (Handy Hint - Â£26/C$40 buys a Total Tower ticket, which gets you to all the various levels of the tower plus several ground floor attractions including a 3D film and a fun river-ride simulator) Overall, definitely enjoyed the stay, and hoping that work will put me up there again if I need to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Small, Intimate in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: FrancisMcInerney
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel at least ten times in recent years. It is small -- not at all like most Intercontinental hotels -- and quite intimate for a Chicago-sized city like Toronto. The staff is helpful and pleasant and the Concierge knows every restaurant in the area. This knowledge is important because Yorkville is Toronto's shopping-eating center. The hotel has a nice, quiet courtyard, excellent in the summer for having a drink away from the bustle of the city, kind of like the Hotel Ponte Sisto in Rome. Do not expect grand luxe or fawning attention. That is not what this hotel is about. For that, go with an open wallet to the soon to open Four Seasons flagship at Bay and Yorkville. If you want quiet, intimacy and location, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Malin L
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very nice, perfectly located in an attractive part of the city but what really distinguishes this place is the service. I have seldom been to a hotel where the services is so consistently exceptional. EVERYONE I met at the hotel from check in to the doorman who helped me with the bags when I left the hotel was so nice, friendly and went the extra mile to help me. The food in the restaurant is excellent and although the hotel is in a very central location the rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “half an hour of wifi for 4.52 $ !”
Reviews.Author: pascale_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bad and makes you pay the most they can for usual free stuff. - 9 $ for a plastic bottle of flat water not even in the fridge, as if it was free ! - 4. 52 $ for an hour and a half of wifi ! - Very bad old matresses, the kind that make you fell on your partner all night long ! Their excuse: we gona make renovations soon ! I imagine price will go up to. I will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “new years eve 2011-2012”
Reviews.Author: arnold s
Reviews.Content: My stay at intercontinental yorkville was enjoyable. Anything i needed they were able to help with including in room barber service. I will definatley stay with them again. Great food and entertainment in the area. Check out Babaluu Supperclub for dinner and dancing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable hotel but disappointing for price”
Reviews.Author: BAStravellers
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights at the Intercontinental on Bloor Street. When we booked, we could have spent another Â£70 more to stay at the Park Hyatt - which we should definitely have done so. The Park Hyatt looks and has the feel of a 5 star hotel (and has a great rooftop bar) - this hotel is tired and there were lots of "niggles". GOOD POINTS 1) If you want to be near high end shopping, then this hotel is a good location. You are about a seven minute walk from Holt Renfrew (a great department store - a bit like Harvey Nichols in London) and almost opposite the Royal Ontario Museum. You are also close to the Bata Shoe Museum. 2) The gym is ok - however, I think if you were staying here at peak time, you would struggle to get on the machinery - there isn't much but what they have is good (2x treadmills, 2 bikes, 1x cross trainer and some weights. There is no rower which is a disappointment.). The pool is nice though - it is indoor and is a nice size. Would be good for children. 3) The bedrooms are comfortable enough - nice linen. 4) Bathroom had separate bath and shower which I always like. BAD POINTS 1) The bar was only open in the evening - which was a shame as we sometimes wanted to go into the bar early afternoon and grab a drink and snack. 2) The food menu was very limited. Not many healthy options either. The breakfast however was fine. 3) We had to wait ages for our lunch order - and we were the only ones in the restaurant. A wait of 35 mins for 2 cold orders is simply not acceptable - no real explanation was given either. 4) They seemed to be really "tight" on towels and shampoos etc - a bit annoying to have to call down for extra. 5) There was no turn down service - I rarely use this but it is nice to have and actually having fresh supplies of shampoo etc brought in would be nice. 6) I resent having to pay for internet - (although there is a free standalone computer in the lift foyer) 7) Wouldn't give us a check out later than 1.00pm (we wanted 3.00pm) without us having to pay for it. This is despite the hotel being very empty. This was in stark contrast to the last three branded hotels (Hilton, Renaissance) I have stayed in when I was allowed until at least 2.00pm and on one occasion until 4.00pm. 8) We couldn't get the ATM bank machine in the lobby to work. If we had this hotel for a steal it would be ok - but I wish we had paid the extra and stayed in the far superior Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “no regrets”
Reviews.Author: colly392
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 2010 and never got around to reviewing it so I'll give my two cents now before the memory is all gone. This would be the most upscale place that I've stayed in and I was not disappointed. The hotel is in a quite upscale neighbourhood in Toronto and is pretty much across the street from a prominent museum, and within walking distance of "high class" shopping. The look and feel of the hotel is in keeping with the neighbourhood. I stayed in a standard room and found it to be very spacious with very good amenities. I particularly liked the bathroom, looked just like what you see on their site. Though I've used them many times I never really liked the shower in the tub set-up that most hotels etc use, I was pleased that they didn't. I also made use of the mini-bar which was kept daily by the "mini-bar guy". The service there was excellent, certainly the best I've experienced. The lady who checked me in was so cheerful I even became skeptically waiting for her to turn. She never did. The staff were consistently friendly, professional, and prompt in their service. My memories of my interactions with the waiters/waitresses, concierge, clerks, doormen, maids are devoid of negatives. After I returned to the island of Dominica I perused more meticulously the mini-bar tab and didn't agree with some of the charges..nothing major. I communicated this with a clerk by email and once again was treated to true professionalism. A supervisor got in on it as well until the bill was quickly rectified...no fuss or headaches from thousands of miles away. Months later I am still impressed with the service that I experienced. If you have never been served by true professionals in the hospitality industry then you need to spend a few days there. I stayed for just over a week. I wish every hotel was like this, I definitely highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “For business trips quite good, not so much for the rest”
Reviews.Author: windfootsteps
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for business in early December. The hotel was standard fare. Fairly cold front desk staff, a little too over eager bell boy -possibly going after tips in a mega expensive city?- with a terrible bar service a few quite arrogant service staff. Some of the bar's employees were definitely more concerned with checking themselves in the mirror than in providing service. Just one holler among many: The waitress didn't take our orders right. Twice. Instead of apologizing, almost threw the napkins and cutlery at our faces. You can see where this movie is going, correct? OTH, rooms were of high standard and the housekeeping staff among the best I've ever seen. Make sure you get a room facing the CN tower. Don't even think about bringing a car as parking can be expensive and the subway is easily accessible from the hotel and if you're conducting business anywhere downtown you can rely on public transportation to get to and fro. After hours, you will be well placed to enjoy many of the venues that are close to the hotel or else within the public transportation's reach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: tasadofi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located across the street from my wedding venue. I contacted them to block some rooms for my guests. They do not have the word NO is their vocabulary. I had a tour months before of the hotel and my guests ended up occupying over 20 rooms (some suites). Now my ceremony started at 3:00pm so most of these rooms needed an early check in. "no problem", "we'll make it happen" is all I ever heard. They provided me with a web link for all our guests to use when booking their rooms. The level of professionalism I experienced with Nancy and her team was incredible. They went as far as having their concierge literally block traffic for our guests to cross the street. All guests gave me great feedback on the rooms, service and breakfast after the wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto weekend”
Reviews.Author: drbrussels
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Very good location. Walking distance to shops at Yorkville. Very friendly staff. Restaurant was very nice. Very good service. I ate breakfast and dinner once. Rooms are large with king size bed. Bar lounge was comfortable. My only regret was that they didn't offer a buffet breakfast. I did not try the room service. The TV was not a flat screen!! I was surprised. But, I didn't watch TV anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed.....”
Reviews.Author: Michelle J
Reviews.Content: I was on a short vacation with my 80 year old Mother and we both had a wonderful stay at the Intercontinental Yorkville. The location was absolutely ideal. The ROM is right across the street and you can also catch the hop on hop off tour buss there too, and Yorkville shops and restaurants are right around the corner. It was great that everything was a short walk away. The customer service was among the best I have ever received at a hotel, and I travel a lot. I was really so pleased with how helpful, and happy all the employees were, it definitely left an impression on me. If I were to return to Toronto I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Lena S
Reviews.Content: The staff and services provided at the InterContinental Yorkvile always exceed expectations. Very professional and friendly staff. You are immediately welcomed and feel transported to a time of service excellence where guests come first. Best location in downtown Toronto - trendy Yorkville shops, the Museum. The hotel rooms and suites have are well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location - Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: RASMAN
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a corner suite. It appears that the mattress and pillows in our room should most likely be upgraded shortly as they have seen better days. We made full use of the pool on the top floor. Super view. Customer service was very helpful for direction to shops close by.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Shannon123456
Reviews.Content: I liked the bed it was very comfy and the flooring was nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumFromSG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Yorkville location from the 18-22 of November. Managed to secure a room facing Bloor St which translated into a good view of the Cityscape at night. All the staffs were very helpful. One thing to note is that the driveway is on the side that heads east so if you're coming from the west you might have to make a u turn on a busy Bloor St. Location wise its very convenient with TTC St. George Station around 3min walk away. Its also very near the U of T for those who need to visit the campus. Tim Hortons is just and intersection away and Shoppers Drug Mart is next door. Special Thanks to Karim for his assistance in helping me in many ways prior to my arrival !

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Lovelier”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: My four-night stay over the US Thanksgiving holiday couldn't have been lovelier at this friendly, smart, elegant, efficient hotel. The staff was delightful and on top of every detail, the room with a view of the city and the fantastic crystal addition to the ROM was immaculate and comfortable with great amenities, the location was perfect for the things I wanted to do and close to the subways for seeing other neighborhoods. I enjoyed every minute of my stay and I can't wait for an opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and meeting space.”
Reviews.Author: Christine F
Reviews.Content: If you need to plan a meeting in downtown Toronto, this is a great hotel. The rooms, service and food were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: REAGHamilton_Ontario
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville for the first time on what turned out to be the weekend of the Santa Clause parade. We had a very comfortable room on the sixth floor with a view of the courtyard. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. Almost everything met our expectations and what didn't exceeded them. In particular the staff at the front desk, the cleaners, the man who took our room service order and the waiter who delivered it impressed us with their friendliness, efficiency and competence. The breakfast we ordered was excellent and beautifully presented. The Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville will be at the top of our list when we plan our next weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Recent holiday weekend”
Reviews.Author: wayne k
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff as always. After 15 plus years of visits we continue to find excellent staff and service continues The location is terrrific- we hope you will remain at that site Wayne Kepron

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean accommodations and impressive amenities”
Reviews.Author: Tanisha T
Reviews.Content: In all my travels to Toronto for business, this hotel has been my absolute favourite for ambience, cleanliness, helpful staff and overall pleasant stay. The front staff members were helpful and friendly right from check-in. The concierge referred excellent restaurants in the area and offered to hold my bags during my meetings, even after I had checked out. The room I stayed in was brilliant with generous space and a lovely view of the interior courtyard. The bed was comfortable, desk spacious and television modern (as well as very large). The room and bathroom were obviously well taken care of and very clean. The lounge was chic and relaxing, and offered an amazing drink menu. The restaurant listed an impressive selection of breakfast options and the food was well prepared and delicious. The meeting facilities on the second floor were bright and enjoyable. The catering was without doubt the freshest and tastiest I've experienced in any hotel. I highly and happily recommend the InterContinental Yorkville to anyone travelling for business or pleasure - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our 6 night stay was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: JOAN G
Reviews.Content: We combined a family wedding with a week's vacation in Toronto. Yours was the "headquarters" hotel for wedding out of town guests, including 5 rooms occupied by our extended family. My husband and I have travelled extensively in North America and Europe and we were delighted with the accomodations, location and service at the hotel. Various staff at your concierge desk were particularly helpful with sightseeing suggestions and setting up various service appointments for us all. Front desk staff were very accomodating and pleasant. We look forward to staying with you again when we visit our Toronto family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fred T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip for two nights. I'm very picky about having a quiet room, since I often have to work in it. I was given a lovely room facing onto an interior courtyard. A little noise from a party below early on a Saturday evening, but otherwise no sound but the garden trees. The service was excellent across the board and the location, across from the University of Toronto campus, convenient too. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “pleasure/shopping”
Reviews.Author: ladymadonna1882
Reviews.Content: This was a really great "spur of the moment" trip. We decided last minute to go to Toronto to have dinner and to do some shopping and were fortunate enough to discover the Intercontinental in Yorkville, Ontario. The close proximity to all the best food and shopping was perfect. Everything that you want is within walking distance. The hotel is directly across from the museum.The hotel was clean and well appointed.The beds were extremely comfortable. Julie, the concierge went out of her way to ensure that we had a seat at a wonderful restaurant. She was so pleasant and very helpful. All around we would definitely stay there time and time again. We are already planning on another excursion !(next time the museums)

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, very restful!”
Reviews.Author: holafromlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this lovely hotel and although our visit to Toronto was for medical reasons, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The staff were very friendly, easygoing and helpful. The location is excellent with the subway just around the corner. Because of the nature of our trip, we chose not to stray far for our evening meal and ate at Signatures in the hotel. It was not a mistake. The meals were very enjoyable, beautifully served and affordable. We would certainly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: Jesse G
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel several times in the past few years, and always found the experience to be standard-setting. On my first visit, while travelling with a good friend of mine, I happened to let on to the concierge that the next day was his birthday and I was looking for some information on events that he and myself and some of our local friends could attend rather than simply going to a bar all night. Not only did the concierge deliver on the event information in a prompt and thorough fashion, but the afternoon of his birthday we returned to our room to find freshly-made chocolate-covered strawberries waiting with the birthday wishes from the hotel. This sort of care is only an example of the quality of service offered. Also worth mentioning is Proof vodka bar in the lobby - especially the bartender Mike, whose conversation and mixology are both top-notch. The rest of the staff stand out as well, I wish I could take the time to mention each one by name. However, no hotel is perfect so allow me to mention the remarkably few negatives I've experienced here as well: Signatures has some excellent food. I've only eaten there twice, but it was quite good (aside from some chicken that was a little salty). The problem is that the meal was lacking atmosphere as we were the only table occupied in the restaurant. Both times. It definitely means you have what amounts to dedicated service, but without any music being played there was a sort of creepy feeling. The second time I visited music was being played at a very subtle level, however, appropriate for such an environment. I don't know quite what to make of the manager at Proof - the gentleman I've encountered as manager twice may simply be shy or may not love his job, but either way a guest shouldn't notice. With the level of service the staff provide, anyone not measuring up to that level stands out. It seems this is an environment where the service succeeds despite the management rather than the other way around. This is likely due to many of the staff predating the newer management. I've not been in a few months, so perhaps this has changed. Back to the hotel itself - the televisions in many of the rooms need updating - flatscreens should have been installed some time ago. The rooms are wonderful until you see those bloody old TV sets - it clashes totally with the contemporary look of the rest of the space. Other than that, I really cannot think of anything else. From the location (in the heart of Yorkville, but close to the Annex) to the staff, the Intercontinental Yorkville remains, absolutely, one of the best hotels I've stayed in. I look forward to returning again soon - it's never been anything but a pleasure. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: iceqween13
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Comfortable rooms. Quiet. Great check in and assistance. Location is perfect -close to subway. Windows that open. Comfortable beds. Overall a great stay for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Meeting! Nice staffs & Nice property!”
Reviews.Author: Hugorock
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is amazing for meeting. The staff are very professionnal, understanding and smiling! The meeting rooms are confortable and We don't need to change 1000 times the temperature in the room. I which to plan an other meeting in Toronto and come back to this property soon! Thanks to all the staff of the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: prevostpilot
Reviews.Content: i was checking in with 10 passengers from spain who didnt speak english and i don't speak spanish but the hotel had a wonderful women who worked there and she stayed with us untill all 10 were checked in and taken care of the room was extremly clean and comfy what a wonderful hotel i actually liked the room better than the four seasons which is around the corner

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1Leg2Legs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on combo business/pleasure. Fast check in. Very nice lobby. Room was spacious and well-appointed. Varsity Stadium is across the street, so was able to get in a track workout. Lots of shopping close by. Starbucks just down street (big surprise in TO).

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Suzel-Z
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at hotel, location on Bloor St is excellent. Great, high-end shopping is down the street and the wonderful Bata Shoe Museum, a block away, is definitely worth a visit. Rooms were spacious and the bed and linens were high quality. Do eat at Buca on King St West and stop by the amazing St. Lawrence Market, too! Look forward to returning to the InterContinental Yorkville!

Reviews.Title: “really fine place”
Reviews.Author: CliftonParadiso
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful, 'tho we didn't ask for much. Location was best around. Going by previous reviews, we asked for high floor, and quiet. They located us interior on the 8th floor, which was quiet. Might've done better asking for a view, where you can look out on the city, but no matter. Yes, even on the 8th, when it was quiet at nite you can faintly hear/feel the Metro. I'm a light sleeper, but it didn't bother me a bit. The bed had lots of pillows, and was fabulously comfy. Lots of space in the room. The bathroom was bigger than some hotel rooms. My only complaint was $$extra for internet??? C'mon, look at the calendar. Even cheapie hotels have free internet. So build in an extra couple of bucks.

Reviews.Title: “recent 3 days”
Reviews.Author: brian b
Reviews.Content: just spent a great 3 days in toronto at the intercontinental on bloor st. service was very pleasant and helpful. room quite large for a standard room. we had a room on a lower floor and could feel the subway rumbling underneath !! get a room higher up also GREAT beds and linens and large bathroom BEST location

Reviews.Title: “If you are ever in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Tom T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Intercontinental Hotel in yorkville in Toronto, and it was the best hotel experience of my life. It is so nice to stay at a hotel where they take real pride in authentic customer service. All hotels are usually nice enough to stay in when I am visiting a larger city, but few places make you really feel at home. From the handsome bellmen to the front desk and the people in the restaurant, everyone was genuinely attentive and friendly. If you are looking for a place to stay while in Toronto you will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but let down by a few points!”
Reviews.Author: paulmcleod10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final 3 nights of a USA and Canada tour. The hotel is in a great location, ideally placed to access all the main areas of Toronto. Our room overlooked a courtyard area, which meant it was peaceful, although there wasn't too much natural light. The room was huge and of a high standard. The decor was very dark and due to lack of light, meant you had to have table lights on all the time. I'd have preferred it to be less gloomy and brighter, but thats purely a personal taste thing though. The bathroom was also large and it was good to have a seperate walk in shower. This has the feel of an upmarket hotel, however, there are a few points that we felt let it down, especially as it's not a low cost place. You have to pay for wi-fi, which I would expect to have available free as a basic standard. Also, they don't provide breakfast, unless you pay for it in the hotel restaurant. I'm sure they could lay on a basic complimentary breakfast. Finally, they do provide coffee making facilities in your room, but you only get one serving per person in a double room and you have to pay for any more. We felt these were just opportunities for the hotel to make more money out of guests, which, considering the cost of their rooms, is a bit stingy of them. Despite this, we did enjoy our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for our holiday”
Reviews.Author: HorseyFan
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel left us with a very good impression. It is ideally situated in a nice part of Toronto with comfortable rooms and staff who really seem to care. There was a small problem with our reservation but this was resolved very efficiently. The only slight concern is that a hotel of this standard does not offer free wi-fi access. We would readily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What Happened to Customer Service?”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa P
Reviews.Content: Imagine checking into a hotel after a long day of travel from Phoenix to Toronto only to discover there was no running water. Now imagine, you've gone through the entire check-in process, credit card and all, before you're told about the problem. But never fear, the hotel has left bottles of water to use for brushing your teeth ... but sorry, the toilets don't work. Luckily, my sister-in-law & I were so exhausted that all we could do was laugh. Turns out, it was not a hotel issue but rather a maintenance project in all of downtown Toronto. Despite that, the hotel did have a heads up a couple days prior but did not contact us to let us know. Naturally, we asked if there was anything they were planning to do to make it up to us. However, the manager on duty felt strongly that because it was not the hotel's fault, he should not have to provide us any sort of compensation. After being quite indignant with us, he finally asked what we would like. We suggested free internet & free valet parking (about a $35 value). For a while he balked but finally agreed. We, in the meantime, still had to endure several hours without running water while paying for a fairly expensive hotel room. The manager was right. It was not the hotel's issue. But, by being so argumentative, I will now associate the brand "Intercontinental" with poor customer service (I had similar customer service issues with the Intercontinental in Phoenix). The company has a fairly good reputation worldwide but will not receive my business again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: scottyth
Reviews.Content: I love intercontinental hotels, and this one is no exception. A great place in beautiful Toronto. Close to everything! Or choose to just stay in and relax, the hotel has it all.Stayed in room 535, checked out on October 16th 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jane'04
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is at the north end of the tourist district. The neighborhood is lovely - the University is right across the street, the surrounding streets are very pretty and there are a number of high end shops in the area. There's a wide range of restaurants ranging from cheap to expensive, and a number of cuisines are represented. There is a metro station a block away, but it's also easy to walk to most tourist spots in the city. Our room was spacious, quiet and very comfortable. I slept better than I do at home. Service from the staff was impeccable, and everyone always greeted us with a smile. Any request we made was promptly taken care of, and the staff went out of their way to assist us. The only negatives are that breakfast and free Internet is not included, but we accepted that when we made the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: justvisitingkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the intercontinental Toronto Yorkville over Canadian Thanksgiving weekend. When I arrived I was disappointed to see our reservation was for a double room even though we had especially requested a triple room. When I asked the front desk to fix it they just gave me a lot of excuses, not solutions....they had no other rooms, I must have made a mistake when I booked it... even though our vouchers showed a triple request. So, this at the beginning of our weekend made me nervous. I requested a cot for our 3rd person and that was out solution. (no apologies) The room was lovely and large. The bathroom was also very large and everything seemed very clean. We had a huge issue with the temperature controls in the room. We were either chilly or sweaty. There really was no in between. When the air was on it would blow right on you. The hotel continued to short us towels (for 3!!) but each time we called down they answered the phone using my name and sent them immediately. I found the Yorkville location to be perfect. Directly across from the ROM. And a short distance from the subway. Yorkville shopping was wonderful. The bell boys were most attentive. Parking around the corner was $22 a night if we parked and $35 a night for the luxury of having the bell boys park the car. I found that a hefty surcharge but they were honest and very upfront about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice amenities, decent service”
Reviews.Author: AndWhere2Next
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville over Canada Day weekend. While it was a little bit out of the way, it wasn't a terribly long walk to the subway or area restaurants and bars. We stayed on the 8th floor, so the pool and outdoor deck were only a few steps away. The hotel was quiet and the service was quite friendly. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: EJTH
Reviews.Content: On business for a 5 day offsite which ran seamlessly and cannot be faulted. As a guest however, especially one who regularly stays in hotels for work, I was disappointed. Sadly this Intercontinental did not live up to the excellent reputation of others in the chain I have stayed in. Malfunctioning lights, missing in-room safe, and broken bathroom fittings and a generally tired looking decor; plus a limited range of healthy food choices on the in-room dining menu led to a disappointing overall experience. When are hotels going to realize that overpriced internet rates just drive visitors, but especially overseas business guests, out of the premises in search of free wifi elsewhere? Duke of York pub just around the corner and immediately behind the hotel offered free wifi, a great atmosphere and large comfy chairs as well as a nice glass of Sav Blanc to aid the thought processes!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and experience”
Reviews.Author: Craig G
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business meeting in Toronto and had a four day stay. The location is great in the middle of city with delightful residental area nearby. Shopping and Dining are within 2 blocks-there were many local establishments that provided excellent personal service. The University of Toronto is nearby and provides a relaxing and beautiful walk (Toronto parks have beautiful black squirrels). The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: Great stay, from the warm greeting on Reception, the really helpful advise from the conceige. Big spotlessly clean room. Nothing was too much trouble as I found when for some reason I left some clothes behind, they were kindly forwarded on to me the next day in the UK! Even beat the postcards. Thank you, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: akell_11
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed here for a birthday weekend. We had a 2 queen bed suite which was very roomy and nicely decorated. Staff stored our bags till the room was ready. They were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. It was easy to get around town from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Chic Area”
Reviews.Author: IrishDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel in September 2011. Gorgeous hotel, with a lovely reception area. There was a little confusion about our dates oncheck in but it was resolved quickly and we were upgraded to a deluxe room. Room was very nice, huge bed, flat screen tv and very spacious bathroom with double shower and a bath. Hotel has an indoor rooftop pool with an outdoor rooftop terrace beside it - lovely. Breakfast was included in our rate and we had a choice of 4 or 5 breakfasts, there were other choices you could pay for. Breakfast was silver service and cooked to order - very very nice on both mornings and service was very good. Hotel is in a very chic area of Toronto, with lots of designer shops nearby. Only reason I didnt give the hotel 5 stars is the fact they charge for wifi - Such a hotel should provide complimentary wifi

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay.....good location.”
Reviews.Author: toocolduphere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided last minute to go to TO for the weekend. Really enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental Yorkville. Not a super huge hotel which we liked. Very nice lobby, hallways and room had a great view of the CN tower ROM, etc. Shower was a bit small but not a problem for us. Location is very good.....very close to prime Yorkville and Bloor St. shopping and lots of restaurants. Service was there if you wanted it, concierge very helpful etc., but not all over you every time you turn around. Next time we wouldn't bother getting breakfast included even though it is a good deal -$10 per person. It was an ok breakfast and nice dining room but there are too many other interesting spots in the area to go and eat. I would definitely stay here again if I wanted to be in this area. (rated sleep quality a bit lower because there were some people being very loud and running up and down the hall late into the night.....but I guess this can happen anywhere)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Clean, Block from Yorkville shopping”
Reviews.Author: TaverAlberta
Reviews.Content: Clean, great service when called upon. Small gym but was able to get a few work outs in. OUtdoor pool and louging area was nice. Essentially a block from where the shopping and entertainment area of Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Ya_YaAlberta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and well located. I found everything I needed here - a fitness facility, a fridge and coffee maker in the room, friendly and helpful staff. This hotel is so well located, right across the street from the mueum and down the street from awesome shopping. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel homebase for TIFF!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie V
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel exceded my expectations, from the size of the room, to the comfort of the beds, to the excellent and accessible service. It is in the heart of Yorkville, minutes from upscale shopping, dining and entertainment. The hotel was full of celebrities during our stay for the Toronto International Film Festival, and my 17 year old twin girls were starstruck! The breakfast in the hotel restaurant was large, fresh and tasty and the service was amazing. I loved every minute of my stay. Thanks to all the hotel staff for making my stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: montefuego
Reviews.Content: The service, courtesy and helpfulness of the Hotel staff, especially the manager Arlene, was exceptional. The rooms are classically and tastefully done. The exercise room is one of the few that actually had a good selection of all the machines I needed, actually in perfect condition. The pool is a lap pool that is long enough to satisfy an ex-competitive swimmer, such as myself. All in all, a great hotel that will always be my first choice in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: YvonneBlack
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent: right opposite the spectaculair ROM, close to the Bata shoe museum and all the lovely shops in Yorkville and on Bloor street. The staff was faultless: friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast was good (thank heavens, no buffet!!). Being an Ambassador member I was upgraded to a studio suite, which, unfortunately I found rather gloomy. But the bathroom and the amenities were impeccable. Minor complaints: the lack of a lively lobby and the uninviting modern bar with its loud lounge music. But fortunately the cosy, jazzy bar of the Park Hyatt hotel is just around the corner...

Reviews.Title: “An older Intercon”
Reviews.Author: feibeesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night in May'11. Located just around the corner from the Four Seasons with the Royal Ontario Museum just opposite. Hotel is a bit dated and not as flashy as the newer InterCons which explains the difference in price with the new one in the CBD. Having said this, it is perfectly adequate and I am happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fair prices clean, big rooms.”
Reviews.Author: adamagi
Reviews.Content: We wanted to book two rooms. They suggested to become an ambassador member and then we can get a room upgrade having a suit for the whole family. Advise was followed and we were satisfied. Suit is big, bath is comfortable, pool is also long enough, centre location, nice people. So we shall come back again when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not particularly impressed!”
Reviews.Author: MitzyLondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other InterContinental hotels and thought they were pretty good and the reviews for this one were pretty reasonable so we gave it a go. Our first impression wasn't great, the check in desk was understaffed and we had to wait quite a while to check in. However, they were able to check us in early which is great. It may be due to the fact the cleaners aren't very thorough! We found hairs in the bath tub and also in the separate shower and I was disgusted to find a used tissue under the bed! For $250 a night it should be spotless. There was also a tear in the bed clothes! We used the gym and the room was stifling hot, they didn't seem to have the air conditioning on which is ridiculous for the gym! Breakfast wasn't included either which seems a bit ridiculous for that price too. When we checked out we mentioned these things and we were told we'd get an upgraded room the next time we stay. Ummm, no thanks. We won't stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnt65
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for three days of business. Bedrooms are clean and generously sized, location is good and the meeting rooms, catering and service all very efficient. The only downside (which to me is quite a big one) is that all the ground floor communal areas smell of odor eater - like one big smelly trainer that they are trying to mask with cheap air freshener. Not sure if this is a temporary blip but let's hope so. Also, the interior design isn't very attractive. If they got rid of the odor issue I would stay here again for business but not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel with a Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here (with my wife) and we really enjoyed the experience. The rooms are quite large, well laid out, and very quiet. A hidden gem is the restaurant which served not only an excellent breakfast but a gourmet dinner at a reasonable price. All staff were helpful and friendly. All in all, this is a top-notch hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandreaF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for our wedding night in July. We booked early and arrived quite late. We were upgraded to a top floor suite and had the most phenomenal view of the Toronto skyline. Everything in the room was perfect, along with complimentary champagne and 3 pm late checkout. We were very pleased with the room and the facilities. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Coug1995
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at this fantastic hotel in downtown Toronto. Having never been to Toronto before I wanted a hotel in a good location that had easy access to public transportation and terrific shopping. The IC Toronto Yorkville did not disappoint. The subway station is one block away, next to the Tim Hortons. The Royal Ontario Museum is across the street and the entire length of Bloor Street is filled with fantastic shopping. The hotel staff at the IC Toronto Yorkville was nothing but friendly, helpful an pleasant to deal with. With Royal Ambassador status I was upgraded to an Executive Suite. The only drawback is that there isn't a club level at this resort, but they more than make up for it with the great upgrade, free minibar, free in-room movie and fresh fruit delivered daily. If you are looking for a great hotel, located in a convenient location, the IC Toronto Yorkville is a fantastic choice. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in cosmopolitan town”
Reviews.Author: curiosa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the university of Toronto, which makes it very convenient for academics, it is also near some upscale shopping.and my friends' house (which I particularly valued. Service is almost perfect:: quick, polite, efficient. Maybe a bit impersonal. The check in process was the fastest I have seen. The room I got was spacious, clean and elegantly decorated; the bed was comfortable and the bathroom, nice and big, though it felt a bit cold. Special mention is due to the cleanliness of the premises. In short: if you're going to Toronto and need to be close to things, but not quite next to the lake, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and stay for family and guests on our wedding weekend.”
Reviews.Author: PixieGirl_TO
Reviews.Content: My (now) husband and I reserved a block of rooms at the Intercontinental Hotel Yorkville for our wedding guests and family who were coming in from out of town for our Toronto wedding. From my first email with Nancy, the Social Sales Manager, no request I had was too big or too small to accommodate. From early checkins to guest gift bags, last minute hospitality drinks arranged for the night before at Proof to the post-wedding brunch on Monday morning in the courtyard, Nancy and her team were only too accommodating. My mom was upgraded to a suite on the 7th floor, which served as wedding central and a special thanks goes out to the housekeeping team who did a quick clean up very early morning on Sunday when I had to start getting ready with hair and make-up. Overall, our guests couldnâ€™t stop raving about the rooms and quality of customer service they received. My husband and I stayed at the hotel on the night of our wedding and were pleasantly surprised to find out that we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and were greeted in room by a tray of chocolate truffles and chocolate dipped strawberries along with bottles of still and sparkling water and a hand written note by Nancy wishing us congratulations on our wedding. Our room was unbelievably spacious and overlooked Bloor Street and the ROM. The weekend truly was an exceptional experience and though my husband and I live in downtown Toronto, we certainly would not hesitate to stay here again as a â€œnight awayâ€� or to recommend this hotel to any of our friends or family on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't consider any other”
Reviews.Author: Mehmet I
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with walking distance access to any shopping facility as well as the charming Yorkville restaurants in the neighbourhood. Excellent breakfast menu with a large choice of delicious pastries. A very polite and friendly hotel staff. Very spacious rooms with great value for money. That is the exact definition of cozy and charming hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in great location at luxury price”
Reviews.Author: delmar78
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville has a great location, impeccable and beautifully decorated rooms, and very attentive staff. If you're on a business trip and don't care about the costs, this is your place. However, if I were not on a business trip, I would choose another hotel because of the inflated room prices which doesn't even include internet or breakfast. Also, the television could use an upgrade (no flat screen in this type of hotel?)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: nicole0811
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental was a great hotel. It's nice and modern and the hallways were quiet all day. We arrived before 3pm, which is the check-in time and our room wasn't ready yet. We handed our bags to the bellman and came back around 2:45p. The front desk said our room was ready, however when we got to the room, the maid was still cleaning! So we took this opportunity to check out the rest of the hotel. The fitness room is adequate, we used it multiple mornings. The pool is a lap pool. It's a little deceiving in the photos on the website. It's all indoors and there is a terrace outside right next to the pool. Other than that, I think the hotel was nice, clean and located next to lots of shopping and restaurants. The concierge was very helpful with suggestions and even arranged for us to rent a car for the day to visit Niagara Falls.

Reviews.Title: “Room rate very reasonable for Yorkville, Room just average though!”
Reviews.Author: HH-Familyof5
Reviews.Content: Only there for 1 night, found the room a bit "tired" looking. Rogers not working - so TV was limited, bar in lobby closed for a private event - so off limits. Room service was nothing special, food very average for the price. Reception staff were solid. Wish when i called and reserved and asked if parking was available - they would have been more clear it was a self park and not valet. Room amenities were not great, found the bathroom shower tiny, not enough toiletries / towels. May stay again, but will likely shop around, even if it costs a bit more. Upon arrival the people in front of me got a free upgrade to the same room i had to pay full rate for??? strange. Would have expected free internet or at least Wi Fi somewhere at no charge - again may deter me from future booking...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: kaberle
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location in Yorkville which is in downtown Toronto. The Yorkville area has great shopping, the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) is basically across the street, and the subway is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. When we checked in the front desk upgraded us (we had a 3 and 5 year old in tow) without being asked to do so which was nice. The room (junior suite) was large, very clean and had a great sized bathroom. We requested a cot which was basically a single bed and came quickly. The valet parking is standard for large cities (about $35 a night), but there is a public parking lot located behind the hotel (a Green P) which has both above and underground parking. We paid about $15 for a 24+ hour stay. There's a rooftop patio with seating and a gazebo and also a lap pool. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveleratl
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a weekend stay at the excellent Yorkville Intercontinental. Rooms and bathrooms are large, comfortable, well appointed and well decorated. The hotel is smaller than the typical Intercontinental, which gives it a more intimate feel, but it is not lacking in any services. The staff is excellent and we particularly appreciated the friendly front desk staff and helpful concierge. The hotel is conveniently located near high-end shopping and eclectic restaurants in Yorkville. Many of Torontoâ€™s attractions and interesting neighborhoods are within walking distance and a metro stop is nearby for longer distance outings. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I have ever encountered!”
Reviews.Author: DebPrins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I "stayed" at this hotel last night. I booked the hotel using an app on my phone and immediately realized I had not entered the correct date. The date I wanted was for the following week. I immediately called Expedia to correct this. They in turn called the hotel and were told it could not be changed. My husband then called the hotel directly and spoke with the Reservation Manager. After spending an entire afternoon trying to fix this situation we were informed by the manager that there was nothing he could do and as a result we had to pay full price for a hotel room that we did not use. Actually "Mr. Reservation Manager" there was something you could have done. Knowing that we intended to stay in Toronto the following week you could have done any of the following; 1) comped us a room for the following week, 2) charged us a base price for a room next week but upgraded us 3) offered us a free dinner in your restaurant 4) offered us a free breakfast 5) offered us free parking. Any of these would have been appreciated. I understand that it's difficult when dealing with third parties: however, as I mentioned earlier, I did try to rectify this error within MINUTES of receiving my confirmation. As a result, we will no longer stay at this hotel and will no longer recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay for my bridesmaids, my family, wedding guests and myself. Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPrima
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the intercontinental yorkville for 2 nights (day before my wedding and the night of). From the beginning when I was there trying to figure out the best rooms/suites for my guests and myself till the end when we're checking out, nothing is too much for the staff who are helping us out during our stay. Nancy at the hotel helped me figure out the best rooms (and the best rates) for us and our guests, and she as well as other staff members were always helpful. If we needed an extra cot, they'll bring it up; if we needed a full length mirror for the girls and I last minute, they'll manage to find one for us too. After my wedding at the royal conservatory of music (which is right across the hotel), I had a lot of left over desserts and food that I brought back which I was worried about storage, but the concierge just graciously helped me with the food storage issue and made it so easy for me. In addition, when I came back to my room after the long day, there was a tray with some chocolate dipped strawberries, 2 glass bottles of water and a card (written by Nancy) waiting in a tray for my new husband and myself, which was a really really nice...it made us feel special. During our stay there, they've also helped us quickly organize an on-suite breakfast and lunch at their patio for my wedding party, photographers, videographers so we won't have to worry about running around for drinks and meals throughout the busy day. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious. The beds are comfy. The hotel is close to high end shopping and some very nice restaurants so it's a very nice area. It's also convenient if you have to travel as the subway station is just a few minutes away. Overall, a very nice hotel with great service and a great location...we would try to come back for our first anniversary for a room with the same view as our wedding suite.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: Sasha0406
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with other family members for a brief summer vacation. Hotel check in was slower than we expected as only one agent was at the front desk and a couple of guests were in front of us. We valet parked the car for a pricey $35 per day but it was very convenient. The staff was helpful and friendly, especially concierge. Rooms are spacious with 2 queen beds, great mattresses and feather comforters . I need a firm mattress for my back and the bed was on the soft side but still offered enough support so I slept well. The bathroom is huge with a separate tub and shower. Also room safe, flat screen tv and mini bar. One of the great hotel features is the lap pool on the top floor, however there is no hot tub. Oh every room also has a cartridge style coffee maker with a small selection of caf, decaf & tea you can load into the machine. The room and hotel was spotless, and the interior pretty luxurious withlots of wood trim and crown moldings. Each room had it's own doorbell. A restaurant and bar rounded out the amenities along with a small but well equipped fitness center. Although the property was on busy Bloor Street it was quiet inside. Overall the location was perfect in ritzy Yorkville, right across the street from ROM, tour bus stops and a block from subway access. We will choose this place again on future visits to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “10th Stay and remains one of our favourites!”
Reviews.Author: rweissred
Reviews.Content: My wife and I frequently visit Toronto and have stayed in just about all the higher end hotels. The Intercontinental Yorkville has, over the years, consistently had the best service and most comfortable ambience. Generally the rooms are great. Unlike some of the giant conference hotels, it doesn't have that hustle bustle and commotion we have found in a number of other places. Extremely pleasant and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: csgc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from two nights in Toronto. The Intercontinental had a great location across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum, three blocks from a great street of shopping and restaurants, and 1 block from the St. George metro stop. The service was good. The courtyard bar was delightful on a summer evening. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. We parked in an open lot behind the hotel for a reasonable rate. The only drawback is that the nightly rate is relatively high. I recommend the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: drsunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night following our trip to Niagara falls. Lovely central location in the shopping and restaurant centre of Toronto across the road from the University and Museum. Very friendly staff. The concierge really made our stay fantastic with great visiting tips for our short visit. Our room with two queen beds was roomy, clean and very comfortable. The hotel decor was first rate. My only criticism was that the wifi was not free

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful concierge services”
Reviews.Author: Sue41378
Reviews.Content: We had great accomodations and the concierge was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “no aircon in the room to cool off in the summer heat”
Reviews.Author: pickycritic05
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel when the summer heat in Toronto struck. The aircond in our first room didn't work and was noisy (some guests complained the same in the past and we thought IC had fixed this. Nope they sure didn't). So in the 32C heat, that was unbearable in the room. We called engineering who came and changed the filter. After 2 nights of hell (hell as in hot room temperature), we couldn't bear it anymore and asked to move to another room. Hotel moved us but the second room's aircond barely worked. It was better but was noisy and the room wasn't cold. We had to leave the hotel on the 3rd night so didn't bother to change the room again. On check out, we told the front desk clerk. Her response was "Really? I'll ask engineering to check". But it was the way she said it that made us feel her "concern" was not genuine. Not impressed with her service. Also i left my cell in the room. I called housekeeping (thanks May!) who found it and told me it would be available for pick up at the front desk. When i arrived, i approached the front desk (the same girl who checked us out) that i was picking up my cell. She asked for my name, a photo id, and the room i stayed. I gave the details to her. She then returned my photoid and asked me to go speak with her manager who keeps all lost items (such as cell phones) in her safe. I then had to wait for the manager to be available and then explain the same thing to her even though i had already explained to the clerk. It was a complete waste of my time to go over the same details to the manager when the front desk clerk could have done that for me after I've expalined to her in the first place. The manager was extremely helpful and managed to locate my cell. Bottom line: If you don't mind crappy front desk service from that girl and a non-working aircond in this hotel, by all means, stay here. If these do annoy you, you should go elsewhere -- who knows, you may be treated like an unwelcome guest also if you're very lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PabloSanJuan
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is a very good hotel and a good value. It is close to luxury shopping and to various attractions like the Royal Museum. The facilities are well kept and the service is sincere and good. This was my first time at an Intercontinental hotel and I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: orientme
Reviews.Content: Everything you want in a luxury hotel. If I could pack up the bed and linens I would, because it was so comfy. Love the proximity to the ROM, the shops and restaurants of Yorkville, and to transportation. The staff was gracious and friendly. Next door to the hotel: Second Cup (coffee), Over Easy (breakfast), and a great drugstore I've forgotten the name of. I'd stay here again in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent especially if you get it for a good price”
Reviews.Author: djkBuf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! My room was huge. Big flat screen tv and I haven't slept that well in a long time! The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Lots of shopping around and it's close to all attractions. Stop reading this review and book it NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: JayRay61
Reviews.Content: Wife and I thought we should get out for a couple of day and ended up here, using up some our Priority Club points in the process... good deal and nice place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls17
Reviews.Content: Finally getting around to reviewing the hotels my wife and i stayed at on our Wedding/Honeymoon trip visiting USA, Canada and Mexico ! We only styaing in Toronto a night after spending some time at Niagra Falls it was quick stop before our flight to New York the next day. I had read lots of reviews on here and was why i choose the hotel. The service was exceptional , they couldnt have been more helpful . We upgraded to a suite and checked in early with no problems. The hotel is in a great location lots of shopping around and across the road is the museum and train station which takes you straight into down town Tornoto ! The room was big , comfy and the bed was great . I did find it a little annoying that you couldnt really watch Tv from the bed thats just a little thing , after a long day of packing all of Toronto into one day we just wanted to lay on the bed and watch Tv. I would highly suggest this hotel as a great base .

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MHarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while going to a concert in Toronto. We got a good price on Hotwire. The room was large and comfortable, with a King bed, loveseat, chair, etc. The bathroom was beautiful with a separate tub and shower, lots of marble and even a bathroom scale. There was lighted art on the wall - no flat screen t.v. yet but the t.v was nicely hidden away in a lovely wooden cabinet so I guess a flat screen would ruin that look. The lobby, etc. was quiet and lovely, and it fits the "boutique" hotel description nicely. If you are looking for something reasonably priced in the ritzy Yorkville area this works well - if you want to be further downtown by the Eaton Centre, or the Entertainment distrcit this is somewhat further away.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful refuge in an exciting city”
Reviews.Author: RonnieSEUnitedStates
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week in mid July 2011. The check in process was easy thanks to a very efficient and friendly front desk worker "Hannah." The room was comfortable and clean. Definitely recommend it for sightseeing in Toronto. It is in Yorkville, an upscale neighborhood with good restaurants and shopping. A bit expensive for wi fi though.

Reviews.Title: “Just the place I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: sdw29ca
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived to the minute I left, the service (including valets, front desk and room service) at the InterContinental Yorkville was beyond stellar, incredibly friendly and extremely professional. I thoroughly enjoyed my (short) stay at the hotel, and will make it my first destination when booking a hotel in Toronto.I highly recommend it to others - both for business and/or pleasure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: PaulaBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental Yorkville in July 2011 for the start of our fly drive. As this was my first visit to Toronto I cannot compare the hotel to any others in the city. The location was perfect for us. Yorkville is a lovely area to stay in - a mixture of residential and commercial properties. The hotel is right across the road from the Royal Ontario Museum. We found lots of lovely bars and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and it felt a very safe area. We ate breakfast in a great diner called Over Easy beside the hotel. We used the tube and the helpful concierge arranged a tour on the hop on hop off bus which stopped right across from the hotel. There were always taxis available right outside the hotel. I did enjoy staying at the InterContinental but I was slightly disappointed with the room. It was spotlessly clean and the bathroom well stocked with towels and toilletries however it seemed dated and in need of redecoration. I was not happy that one of the sockets had several wires, and the socket itself, hanging out of the wall. Once I did settle in I found the room very comfortable and quiet and we slept well each night. I would not rate this hotel any higher than 4 stars and would consider staying again, although there are other hotels in the city I would like to try. Toronto is a fabulous city to visit. So much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale locaion, nice decor”
Reviews.Author: HighTechTraveller
Reviews.Content: The intercontinental Yorkville is a nice hotel in a high class area of town. There are nice restaurant and an entertainment area within walking distance. The hotel itself is starting to show its age and is not very well suited for business travellers. e.g the restaurant only opens at 7am which was too late for me on the 2 days I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great location - no free internet”
Reviews.Author: thilly13
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at a deluxe room at the hotel in July 2011as part of our "Toronto leg" of our Canada trip. The room was spacious, decorated nicely in earthy tones, had a super comfy bed and was overall well kept. Housekeeping was excellent and we never heard any noise, so I assume that it also had good isolation. Everybody was extremely friendly and helpful and especially the valet parking was super fast. Whenever we came back from our numerous shopping trips, there was always someone welcoming us with a big smile. We tried the bar (average cocktails) and enjoyed the rooftop pool for one day, but mainly we spent our time around town. The one thing that did disappoint us, was the lack of free high speed internet. Even at the business centre they required you to pay like 5 Dollars per half hour. This is absolutely ridiculous, as everyone knows the real cost for providing this service. All the other hotels and B&Bs on our trip offered internet services free of charge. We stayed in other hotels in Toronto before, but this one beats everyone in terms of location. If you walk out of the hotel, you have Yorkville at your doorstep with lots of restaurants and great shopping. We are planning another trip next year and will definitely come back to this hotel! Hopefully by then they provide free internet :o)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: SusanKakabekaFalls
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have stayed at the InterContinental Toronto Yorkville hotel and the experience was first rate. The customer service was excellent - helpful but not intrusive.
