The front desk staff were very helpful to my husband, who was having trouble printing off our airplane boarding passes ( a service to hotel guests). They guided him through the process to a successful end. Also, the check-out time is 12 noon which allowed me to make use of the pool and fitness centre. These are located on the top of the hotel and give extraordinary views of Toronto. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant because of all the amazing restaurants within walking distance. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of museums, shopping, restaurants, and the unique "Yorkville". We had dinner at a street side cafe in Yorkville and enjoyed the street action. Then we meandered our way back to the hotel. The hotel is also located near the subway stations. This was convenient to get around Toronto cheaply and quickly. Our room was on the inside, over the courtyard, and very quiet. The street noise could not be heard. The room was beautifully appointed and comfortable. We had a king bed which was very comfortable. My husband and I would highly recommend the InterContinental Toronto Yorkville hotel and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, but a few problems.”
Reviews.Author: Angeg72
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Intercontinental Yorkville and all of my experiences prior to this were great! My husband and I brought our children for a couple of days of fun and sightseeing in Toronto. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so the Bell Captain took our luggage. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room (with two queens) was lovely, clean and perfect for what we needed. However, we were on the third floor at the back of the hotel and the subway was roaring by underneath us all night. The tube TV hadn't been replaced with an LCD (as mentioned by the manager in a January review). Also, there was no top sheet on our beds. A white bottom sheet and a wonderfully fluffy comforter, but no top sheet. Next time I'll ask for a higher floor room at the front of the hotel! I do recommend it, I was just disappointed in this stay. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Happy staff”
Reviews.Author: donnyjs
Reviews.Content: The most pleasant and happiest front desk staff that I have met! Greeted with a smile every time, and very courteous. This extended to practically all of the staff that we encountered. Breakfast was included in our deal which made it good value. You had to order â€œa la carteâ€� (no buffet) which meant that choice seemed a bit limited and I would look elsewhere if not included in room rate. However, quality was excellent. Location is good for the boutiques and restaurants around the area, and almost directly opposite the Royal Ontario Museum. Perhaps not the best location for sight seeing, but you are close to the metro station to help you get around Nicely decorated room, and very comfy bed. The only area that needed some attention was the bathroom which had one or two rather shoddy repair jobs. Overall a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i keep returning......”
Reviews.Author: AGR1958
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this delightful hotel many times over the last 15 years and keep returning, because I have had a first rate experience each time. There is a strong proactive management team, including amongst their ranks, Swiss hotel school alumni and those with experience in many countries. The quality of management filters down to all levels of staff, whom I have found to be very friendly and eager to ensure that oneâ€™s stay is enjoyable. The standard of cuisine is extremely high. I am impressed by the fact so much is made from scratch by an international team. The modest size of the hotel appeals to me, for the personal recognition standpoint. Notwithstanding this, this Intercontinental is well appointed. Of particular attraction to me is the well designed swimming pool with skylight, sauna, steam room, gym and roof garden. The location is excellent: on Bloor Street, just seconds away from very high end shops; The Ontario Museum and the University of Toronto. I have read several of the other, very positive, reviews on this hotel and its highly motivated staff and am pleased to note that other travelers have enjoyed their stays as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sniklep
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stopped the car outside the hotel, the staff were excellent! Valet parking (if you want it), pleasant and helpful reception staff, restaurant service personnel were efficient and unobtrusive. We only had breakfast, but the choice was enough to suit most tastes and was delicious, well prepared and served with as much coffee as you could drink! The room was clean and well equipped and had a bottle of water and chocolates on arrival. (Don't know if that is in every room, we were on the top floor). The bathroom had extra towels as well as the usual small bottles of soap, shampoo etc. The public areas were nicely decorated, cool and clean. Would stay here again with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Service was the BEST ever!”
Reviews.Author: DMF1144
Reviews.Content: Carolina Avaria, Concierge mamager, arranged dinners, plays, sights, car rental etc and truly made our first trip to Tononto outstanding! We did and saw everything and loved Toronto. Hotel staff was great. Hon. Malcolm and Doree Fromberg---Miami Beach,FL

Reviews.Title: “Our Yearly RendezÂ·vous with Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: Honestray
Reviews.Content: Once a year, we stay at this hotel to stay connected with the city and enjoy what Yorkville has to offer. The hotel meets all of our needs. Professional staff, helpful concierges to book us shows tickets or restaurant reservations, and effective valet parking people. The room was very clean as usual with a view on busy Bloor St. Ideal location to shop in Yorkville and enjoy nice restaurants, e.g. Ciao Wine Bar. And always our late visit to the Proof Vodka Bar for a relaxed atmosphere. We like this hotel and its excellence in service, quality, and location. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in TO Yorkville.”
Reviews.Author: Gabi42
Reviews.Content: Fantastic central location with spacious, clean & quiet rooms. Very nice staff. Great fitness room with indoor heated pool and sun deck on the upper floor where we had a king size bed room. Very good value for Yorkville, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Carolina is amazing -- a jewel!”
Reviews.Author: pickyroadwarrior5
Reviews.Content: Great location and best of all is the astoundingly capable Carolina, the concierge. She helped with the full spectrum of bookings -- train schedules, restaurants, etc. She recommended incredibly great "hidden gems" that no tourist would think about for walks, fine cuisine, brilliant ambience. She is a treasure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience.”
Reviews.Author: FlyingTreeFarmer
Reviews.Content: An Oasis of calm and relaxation after a hectic week touring with clients in Montreal & Ottawa. Fantastic bed, quiet room and gracious and attentive staff. Thanks again,

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RossJohn1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental on the occasion of my 50th birthday. My wife wanted to create something special to mark the event. Upon check-in, our reservation was kindly upgraded. Our room was gorgeous, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. We were already impressed with the lobby when we arrived. The front desk staff were very polite and professional. That evening, rather than going out for a meal, we had dinner in the dining room. I had a few minor dietary requirements that were immediately accommodated. The meal and service were first class, adding to the memorable evening. At the end of the meal, a dish of chocolate treats was brought to our table with the hotels compliments. If that wasn't enough, when we went back to our room, there was a plate of hand dipped chocolate strawberries awaiting with a note from the Concierge (thank you, Evan!). The day couldn't have been made more perfect. The location on Bloor Street was convenient for shopping, especially since Yorkville was just blocks away, and the subway station was directly around the corner. You can walk off your plane and easily arrive at the front door for just $3.00 if you use public transport. Special thanks to Carolina Aviara - Chef Concierge for making everything happen. We will definitely return! Ross B. Winnipeg, MB.

Reviews.Title: “InterCon. Toronto Yorkville is my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: newtorontonian
Reviews.Content: May 12-16th was my 4th stay at the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville. I love this hotel. I have stayed 3 times in their Standard King rooms. This past May was my first time booking a Studio Suite (I was later moved). Try to avoid booking a studio suite, the standard rooms (king or 2 queens) are far superior. The studio suites are laid out poorly and the furniture is arranged awkwardly (the T.V. is next to the bed, but you can't see the TV from the bed). I do love this Hotel, the furnishings are beautiful and their bathrooms are well appointed with marble and chrome. I enjoy their Standard Rooms and Executive Suites but they really missed the mark with their Studio Suites. As always the service was exceptional and the staff go the extra mile to keep the patrons happy and fulfill their desires (especially the front desk staff). The front desk staff upgraded and moved me because of the room they promised didn't have a city view. It impressed me they would go to that length to accommodate me. The doormen are very friendly and knowledgable about directions. Mohammed has really impressed me and I've gotten to know him during my stays at the hotel. The breakfast food from room service is amazing. Their eggs benedict is one of the reason I come back. However, room service is a bit on the expensive side, especially with the service charge on a delivery for one person. During my stay the pool was a bit dirty (had toilet paper at the bottom). I've never experienced that before at this hotel, so I'm a bit perplexed about it. That's the only negative thing I have to say about my last stay.

Reviews.Title: “feeling like home at ICH Toronto Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodBoo
Reviews.Content: it is a smaller boutique hotel of Intercontinental Hotels.. centrally located, so any direction I walk there are things to see and do.. going west on Bloor St is small shops and Little Korea, going east on Bloor is branded shops you see in NYC fifth avenue (must visit the charming Starbucks on Yonge and Bloor). I am amazed by the quietness of the room because the windows are superior quality (and they can be opened for fresh air). The workout gym and swimming pool is well maintained and there's a terrace for quiet thinking space. Bathroom has large space with extra large bathtub. Finally, the staff are all happy people.

Reviews.Title: “We loved and We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: KuwaitRanda
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice, well managed, staff need to know more about the services around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a place”
Reviews.Author: seanallan
Reviews.Content: from top to bottom very Great, the staff was great , the rooms were like home away from home, i would tell any one to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: lancexfang
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental operates in about the same level as Waldorf Astoria, St Regis, Park Hyatt and JW Marriott. These brands tend to occupy the market right below FS and Ritz but above everyone else, as far as major chainsâ€™ concern. Their rates are usually set in the same spectrum as well, and tend to congregate to the same locale. This is probably a true statement in general, while it may vary a little bit for individual market or properties. In the case of IC Yorkville, this is certainly the case. So, the question is, how would it differentiate itself from the competition and create customer loyalty. They have answered it well, with a world class customer service. It may sound boring. And customers are inundated by clever marking propaganda and promises these days about putting customer first. However, when it does happen, people would still recognize it. The staff members that I encountered were friendly and responsive. They are ready to go above and beyond. They stand behind their words. I have top tier status with Hyatt, IHG, Marriott and Fairmont, and mid-tier with SPG and Hilton. The service I received at IC Yorkville is truly exceptional. You can probably expect about the same level of luxury and product in terms of hardware in all these major brands. But if you are looking for a great experience, at least in Toronto, you donâ€™t have look any further. I know it because itâ€™s not only the individual staff members that consistently come through, but the overall culture at this place that very much impressed me. Let me finish with just one small example. They listed all their managerâ€™s email addresses on their website. It may sound trivial. To me thatâ€™s commitment that they will be there when you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Yorkville Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vulcan11
Reviews.Content: First time at the Intercontinental in Yorkville, location was convenient, stayed in a large, very clean, comfortable, quiet room that faced the courtyard. Service was excellent, staff courteous, prompt, helpful and very friendly. Will definitely stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best front desk/receptoion in a long time!!”
Reviews.Author: crewtips
Reviews.Content: Sarah was impressive. Professional, friendly, attentive, knowledgeable. I loved the Intercontinental because of the way she welcomed us. She suggested we try "Proof", their martini bar. We loved it. I had some excellent ginger-grapefruit martinis and scrumptious clams and chgorizo appetizer. Our room was an executive King, very comfy with a fab view of the museum. Great room. The shower is tight but you get a separate bathtube, the terrace with inside pool a nice feature. You cannot beat it for the price. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel,excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: mebrow
Reviews.Content: We have used this hotel several times per year,over the past 5 or 6 years and love it. Smaller than some neighboring hotel and ultimately more personable. Convenient location to subway and most major sights. The rooms are modern,well maintained and impeccably clean. The entire staff, from the doormen, the receptionist, to the housekeepers are friendly, always professional, cooperative and willing to assist you during your stay. The same can be said of the manager,Rolf.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff/service, great location, clean and very confortable”
Reviews.Author: The_Attorney
Reviews.Content: Everything in the title. Very friendly and professionnal staff, perfect location for shopping and visits. But I must add a great plus for the confort here ! The bed was so confortable that I wanted to buy it !! Honnestly, I am used to 5 star hotels, but I must admit that the bedding of this hotel was over the top !! I highly recommand !!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice rooms, great location, no free WiFi.”
Reviews.Author: warlicht
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick 48 hrs visit to Toronto to catch-up with some old friends. The location of the hotel is great with lots of shopping and restaurant very close-by. The hotel is clean and the staff extremely helpful and checking in and out was very quick. The rooms are spacious and clean so overall I would rate the hotel very highly. The only inconvenience is that the hotel charges for WiFi in the rooms and does not offer Free WiFi in the lobby. I think that nowadays this should be complimentary especially considering the price level of the hotel - otherwise would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ljacinto
Reviews.Content: Are trip was to go visit our daughter and birthday celebration. Was not sure on location but when we got there you could not ask for a better area. We were very pleased with everything. Top service very friendly, concierge go out of there way to make your stay a great one. Was awesome would defianately go back and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My fourth happy visit to this wonderful property.”
Reviews.Author: mikeymaki
Reviews.Content: I've never been disappointed staying at the Intercontinental Yorkville. The staff are outstanding - always cheerful and helpful. The rooms are very quiet and comfortable. We've hosted family brunches and dinners at the very fine restaurant and everyone enjoys their meals. There is a small but well equipped exercise room, and a great pool that is never busy. The bonus is the area - a short walk to terrific restaurants, shopping, galleries and museums in a very safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: luigipasta
Reviews.Content: excellent staff, comfortable beds but somewhat noisy. excellent food in signatures restaurant

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: janyyc
Reviews.Content: What a great staff! Very helpful and kind. I'd say the hotel is on par if not better than the Park Hyatt that's next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Beautiful Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jenni55
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the InterContinental, and overall it was a great stay. The beds were so comfy, with up to date furniture and electronics. The location was superb, with the Museum stop a 5 minute walk away. The only complaints I would have about this hotel was the subway, which was very loud and we were on the 6th floor, and the staff. We asked to be checked in a little earlier than the 3 o'clock time, and were told no and if we were part of the priority club, it would be no problem. I do not like to be solicited when trying to check into a hotel. The other complaint would be that that my spouse and I asked where a good local sports bar was in the area, and the man at the front desk only recommended the restaurant in the hotel, and was unhelpful with anywhere else. Other than that, we had a great stay, and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “No free lobby WiFi what an embarrassment!”
Reviews.Author: hmiecz
Reviews.Content: Hotel, cleanliness, service and resources were fine. Safe in the room. Now two major problems. 1) I stayed on the top floor and I felt and heard the subway car every time it passed which was at least every 5 minutes. 2) Come on people,it's 2011 now and the hotel still doesn't have free WiFi in the lobby. For goodness sakes, the city of Toronto offers free WiFi in certain parts of the city to homeless people and the intercontinental hotel can't give it to us for $170 a night? They should be embarrassed. It's time we as consumers demand such services as the hotels keep increasing their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: RLeonardo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, the staff are very accommodating and friendly, and the restaurant was fantastic. I have already booked the next 4 weeks at this hotel based on my experience. There are several restaurants nearby, short walk to downtown, and easy cab/subway ride to major destinations. I highly recommend this hotel. RLeonardo

Reviews.Title: “One of the friendliest and most accommodating hotels!”
Reviews.Author: hbinteriors
Reviews.Content: I decided to have a weekend away and invite my grown children to join me for a littl;e family bonding time. I wanted to stay in the Yorkville area for easy access to shopping and fine restaurants. Out of the higher end hotels I called, Intercontinental gave me the best weekend rate. Upon check in, the front desk gentleman, named Himanshu, very politely welcomed me and smiled constantly. Some of you may not find this important but when you meet the contrary and find someone who is very unhappy at their job, it doesn't set a very nice tone. Anyway, I asked if it was possible to upgrade my room should something be available and Himanshu again, very gladly accommodated me. Once in the suite, I received a call from Himanshu to see if I was satisfied with the room he gave me. It was beautiful..... very clean, renovated, and elegantly decorated. How could I not be thrilled. Although we never ate at the hotel, we did have drinks in the lounge and all was great. The staff at the Intercontinental definitely go out of their way to take care of you all the way from the bell hop, to the front door attendants, to the front desk. I would definitely stay there again and intend to!

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've had in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Calgary_traveller_11
Reviews.Content: Form the moment you walk up to the door to when you leave, the service was beyond excellent. Every staff person took the time to make me feel welcome and comfortable. Front desk and room service staff in particular were well past my expectations. Everyone was sincere and seemed to truely want to do the best for the customer. Comfortable and clean rooms with excellent bed and good desk space. Not the latest in terms of technology - old TVs, etc. - but I wouldn't let that deter me from staying again. Service more than makes up for it!

Reviews.Title: “This is a quality hotel with an excellent location, food and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BonitaGuelph
Reviews.Content: If you want to shop at very high quality stores, visit art galleries and enjoy the Royal Ontario Museum, this is the spot for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: BHab_07
Reviews.Content: Hearing I would be in Toronto for a week-long class, a colleague recommended this hotel, then the sponsoring organization actually scheduled the class here! My colleague was right. The location is superb: within walking distance of Yorkville's eclectic shops and restaurants, and wonderful museums; the service is friendly, unobtrusive, and effective; and the room was luxuriously comfortable without being ostentatious. Little touches like duvets on the bed, great hand-moisturizer in all the restrooms; the guy who unobtrusively removed magic marker the instructor used by mistake on the whiteboard while the instructor continued on, AV help that magically appeared when needed all made this a great place to stay for a week. Tip 1: For a quick affordable lunch, the Whole Foods three blocks away has great sandwiches and fresh fruit. Tip 2: Check out the Bata Shoe Museum down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff is wonderful Sarah was outstanding made me feel like the #1 guest”
Reviews.Author: bobbyryan
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying at this hotel and my colleagues had a hard time getting me to come here just so you know. I was coming from another hotel down the road that I loved and that made me feel like I was at home. These are very high standards to try to beat your staff here are great and have done very well so far. I would however like to see a little larger tv and maybe counters and different sinks. These are easy things to get over in my books but never the less still important to tell you. Again not to forget Sarah at the from desk was outstanding my first night this week my reservation was not made and Sarah took care of me without losing a step. I have to say with staff like her you will not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: allyurwishes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the week-end of April 2 -3. The staff - from doorman, to valet to reception to concierge were always friendly and helpful. The location is ideal for shopping, art galleries and restaurants and its a great area just to walk around. Our only comment is that we found the room to be too warm and the AC did not cool the room down and the fan was too noisy. Maybe it was just the room we were in - 404. We will still stay again though and hope the AC issue is resolved next month when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: rbraide
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Bloor St Intercon more times than I could count but stopped for a while due to loud construction in the area. That's in the past now. They seem to try harder than most hotels, maybe because of the hardships they had to live through with things being built all aaround them for the past four years. I love the place. Nothing has ever lessened the experience save for the construciton noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: LacrosseMommy111
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week in the city of toronto for a conference with a number of colleauge's. With my job I'm priviliged to be able to travel all across north america throughout the year, staying in a number of high class hotels (and some not so high class hotels as well ;) ). I've always maintained that any trip you take will be made or broken by where you sleep, and I will say that the Intercontinental yorkville made my trip. I've never been wowed by the staff at a hotel the way they wowed me, everyone from the front desk straight through to the housekeepers were friendly and genuinely cared about my level of comfort. The valets were extremely charming and quite funny, they knew me by name even before I told them. Doormen are so often cold and robotic, to have had such genuine and charasmatic young men was a real treat. They made my stay, which overall was the best hotel experience I've ever had. Thank you Intercontinental!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Restful”
Reviews.Author: n_mcnaughton
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were most helpful and pleasant . The front desk staff were couteous, efficient and friendly as was the valet parking staff. The hotel food is wonderful and the bar is a lovely combination of cozy and classy . The room was spacious clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Toronto Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jenk54653
Reviews.Content: Elegant, fancy rooms, staff very attentive. However, our room was uncomfortably warm and despite several calls, we found out there was nothing they could do about it. The A/C couldn't be turned on. Even with the windows cranked wide open 24hrs/day, it stayed really warm. We also lost our luggage and despite staff being aware of this from our frequent calls to check on it, I was annoyed that they didn't offer ideas of where to get needed personal items, etc. Other than that, no concerns or complaints. Very fashionable room, kind of tight on space.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service & location”
Reviews.Author: PrairieRover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel, Yorkville last week while attending a course for work. I also stayed on some extra days to visit friends & family in the area. This is one of the best big chain hotels I've stayed in. The hotel is very conveniently located across from the Royal Ontario Museum, and is in the heart of some of the most exclusive shopping areas in the city of Toronto. The University of Toronto campus also extends into this area, which means there are a lot of reasonably-priced places to eat, as well as more upscale restaruants. The hotel is simply but tastefully furnished, and is spotlessly clean. It was a relief to be in a place that didn't have the pervasive cleaning products odour that so many hotels have. My single room was very large very clean and well laid out, with a king-sized bed, desk, couch, chair and 40" (I think) LG flat screen TV. The bathroom was palatial with separate tub & shower areas. The only negative aspects were the temperature, which was too hot for me, even with a settable room thermostat, and the noise. My room was right on Bloor Street, which is a major artery with a lot of traffic at all hours. With the window open for cool air, it was loud at times. However in summer and winter you would be running the in-room heating/cooling system, so noise would be reduced. If you're a light sleeper ask for one of the rooms at the back of the hotel. The staff are exceptional. Everyone I encountered was friendly, professional and went the extra mile. Two things in particular stood out. I arrived at the hotel with a coat that needed repair, and the concierge arranged for the in-house cleaning/sewing staff to not only clean & repair it but completely refurbish it, for a very reasonable price. The second was the responsiveness of the restaurant and banquet staff to my requirement for gluten-free meal options. All the wait staff were very familiar with gluten-free needs, but the kitchens had no GF items in stock. By the third day of the conference, they had brought in GF bread, rolls and waffles, and also created a wonderful dessert for one of the coffee breaks. This kind of recovery shows a remarkable attention to detail and concern for customer comfort. The hotel isn't in the budget range, but there are discounts available through auto leagues and special promotions. If you're in Toronto and want a relaxing place to stay where you're well looked after, I strongly recommend the Intercontinental Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: JhughesShantyBay
Reviews.Content: We landed at The Intercontinental via the 'secret location' destination thru Expedia at a great price and we felt so fortunate to have settled into such an over the top location for a 3 day weekend in Toronto. As a child I had spent time in the halls of the Royal Conservatory of Music and to look across the road, to feel the nostalgia, to attend a wonderful concert at Koerner Hall, and walk the streets of Yonge and Bloor area - fantastic. Even observed the St. Patrick's Day Parade from our window. And then there was The Intercontinental - the comfort of our rooms and bed, the warm, welcoming service (to a person) any hour of the day or night. Thank you to Mathew and Rolf for excellent room selection; to Evan, the concierge, for a superb reservation for dinner in Yorkville (as we had requested); and to helpful in house staff for requests promptly handled. We felt well cared for and special, and look forward to another lost weekend in downtown Toronto with you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff - made me feel like a valued guest”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelld
Reviews.Content: I actually didn't stay here this trip (although I have previously). I had planned to and I worked long with Hannah to secure a good spacious room for our family trip to downtown Toronto. It was a stay on Priority Club points and she had to go far out of her way to negotiate with them to enable my stay. We needed this stay to be as perfect as possible, as people will know, traveling with a young child can have it's many challenges if everyone is to enjoy themselves. In the end I didn't choose to stay here as there is no Intercontinental lounge (the hotel is too small) and I regret that. The location we did choose was a disappointment overall but once bedded in to a place it can be difficult to move. This hotel has good quality rooms and great facilities and it's smaller size makes it feel much more cozy than other larger hotels - and as proven by this trip planning and echoed by other reviews, the staff here works hard to make your stay comfortable and to make you feel as if they really value your business. I will definitely plan to stay here next time and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but not the best value given all the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Apriljl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights to catch the Leafs--Blackhawks game and to take a long weekend. This was our second trip to Toronto in the last year and our first stay at this hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location in the beautiful Yorkville neighborhood. We walked or took public transit everywhere. The room was spacious and clean with a comfy bed. We booked a bed and breakfast package which was worth it--breakfast was big and filling and we hardly had room for lunch. We also used the fitness room which was nicely equipped. Now for the not so great--for the price you pay the hotel is not the greatest value, especially given that wireless Internet is not free, which is an enormous pet peeve of mine in hotels these days. Smart hotel chains have realized this and for the price, it should have been included. We had several devices with wireless Internet and were stunned to see that the fee was per device on our bill, when that was not explained anywhere. When I pointed this out, they took it off the bill, which was nice but nevertheless a bit cheesy. We also noticed the gratuity for our breakfast that was supposed to be included was on our bill. Again, they took it off. I recommend this place for comfort and location but not for value.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best kept non pretentious yet elegantly comforting places to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: torontograd
Reviews.Content: Just had the pleasure to stay at the Intercontinental Yorkville Hotel in Toronto secondary to attending a conference. Having stayed at a number of places in Toronto in the past, I was expecting simply a clean room. However, the experience was nothing but superb! Service was excellent - from the bellhops to the reception to the cleaning staff. The food was outstanding! The rooms were extremely comfortable and a good size - a warm and inviting style with a large bathroom and decent sitting area. The bed was very inviting and gave a great sleep. The location is ideal - close to restaurants, shopping and safe to walk around. You may not notice the hotel as you walk by however, don't be fooled....it is a very inviting place. You will not be disappointed!!! All 5 fingers up!!

Reviews.Title: “Rehash of other reviews - Fantastic experience, bring your own internet!”
Reviews.Author: Nevileon
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned previously, the customer service in this hotel is top notch. I managed to get one of the remaining unrenovated rooms on priceline (for 90 USD / night. Wow) - which was a great value. Check in was a breeze. Everybody on the way in was very friendly (the doorman and desk staff), despite it being 11:30 PM on a Sunday. I felt especially welcomed by one front desk staffer in particular (I think her name was Sarah - but I'm TERRIBLE with names). She welcomed me back to the hotel every time I walked by (ninja stealth or otherwise), and seemed genuinely happy to chat when it wasn't busy. Many of the little things are probably going to get addressed with the reno's. The room was in need of a few repairs (shower head, cracked tiles & chipped bathtub), and the television had seen better days (the power button was crushed, and the TV itself was from the turn of the century). However, for $90 / night in such a fantastic location, those were minimally distressing. My remote didn't work at first, but after I mentioned it, it was fixed in the time it took to meet a friend for coffee. The king bed was amazing. The fitness centre was more than enough for my needs. Two treadmills, some other misc. machines, and enough weights that 1-2 people could work out at the same time. The pool was also quite nice. I didn't get to try the restaurant or vodka bar. Others have mentioned the high price of internet. That bears repeating. Despite my best efforts - there was no free wi-fi in surrounding buildings to borrow from. I'm sure the internet provided for $12 / night IS quite fast, but since I was staying for 9 nights, it actually ended up being cheaper for me to go purchase high speed internet from Wind mobile once I landed (Stick was $60, internet was $25 / month and it too, is fast :) Summary: Highly recommend, fantastic service and just a small couple snags. If you can get your corporation to pay for everything, it's even better! =)

Reviews.Title: “Through courteous staff and a beautiful room it couldn't get much better”
Reviews.Author: A1219
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay in Toronto and decided to stay at the Intercontinental Yorkville as it had been recommended to me in past. The front desk team were very friendly and efficient from the get go. I was more then pleased with my spacious room that had a beautiful view looking over the Royal Conservatory and D/T skyline. As well the physical location is a wonderful one for someone that may or may not know the city. It's very close to the subway system, as well is a 5 minute walk from the main shopping/entertainment district of Yorkville. For only being able to stay in the city for 1 night, this was the perfect location to deal with all of my needs. The room rate was more then fair for the again the location and Proof Bar was a fantastic spot to grab a drink or two before heading off into the night!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel sleep EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: deedzMontreal
Reviews.Content: We had not been to Toronto in 20 years. My husband owns a hotel in Montreal and so we are accustomed to travelling all over the world. I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised at how charming this smaller version of the Intercontinental chain is. When we first arrived (Feb.19) the front desk clerk (Monique) was most charming. We checked in at 6:00p.m. and the hotel was full so she did her best to get us an upgrade since our reservation which was for a kingsize bed werea only available at this time in the suites. She then called one of the managers to approve the upgrade. He was even more pleasant than she was. The doormen were extremely helpful since we did not know much about getting around in the city. We had drinks before going to dinner at the bar in the hotel. Amber, the bartender/waiter was extremely nice and knew his drinks and cheeses very well. All I can now say is that we will be going back often to Toronto for business and the Intercontinental is the place to stay in Yorkville. Thank you to all the staff for taking such good care of us. Ilda (Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: andrewchen5000
Reviews.Content: Last year (2010) was the first time I stayed in this IHG property and I became immediately loving the Yorkville area, and also this hotel. Perhaps it is an old hotel, nothing really fancy about the rooms, the location is good, and the staff membes are great. I always like those doorman boys are very good, professional, eager to help. This time around, I was revisiting this hotel with an elevated priority club membership - royal ambassador. Like before, I had two reward nights and one paid nights, on the check-in, the lady was pleasantly addressing me by offering to just combine the two separate bookings into one paperwork, and upgraded me to a StudioSuite. I did request 816, close to the gym workout/fitness room but it was unavailable. When I was asking about the benefit of accessing the mini-bar for being a RA member, I got a clear answer. After checking in, I was afraid of being overcharged and phoned the concierge desk about the minibar access, i was offered a quick and clear answer quickly. Even though the mini-bar was not re-installed, but I was happy that I was abble to get some soft drinks after working out and sunna room, given the bad weather outside. When I was checking out on Sunday, the checkout lady was asking if I was aware of the mini-bar benefit during my stay. Although the guest rooms could use some re-skinning or refurbishing or renovations (the latest was that the flat-screen TVs are being installed in all the rooms, and my room did have a new TV), the lobby and the function room floor (2nd) look very classically luxuous and splendid, and I like alot. Overall the minor issue is that the TV inputs are still analog (yes, installed new flat-screen TV), and the channel choices are not great. However, I still overall have received good impression on this hotel. I do think the staff members are great. I travel to Toronto a lot, and used to stay in the city centre Intercon hotel (the old Crowne Plaza upgrade), but now feel a lot to prefer staying in this property. I also love the 24-hr fitness room access, and self-adjusted sauna room, which I used every day. I assume this hotel might still be a good choice for many conference goers, as the guest rooms are not particularly chic, just steps away from the ROM and Yorkville shops, and easy access to TTC subway stations, I would recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service in the City”
Reviews.Author: coledale60
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville was an integral part of our bachelorette party celebration on February 5th. We planned to have dinner at a local restaurant in Yorkville so we needed to find a hotel close to the restaurant where friends and family could gather before dinner and where some could sleep after the party. There are several upscale hotels in this area, all of which were checked, but none met the criteria like the InterContinental Toronto Yorkville. It was the obvious choice. From the moment I walked through the front door of the Intercontinental and spoke to Rolf Kenda (Front Office Manager), I was so well taken care of that I cannot think of another hotel experience that comes close to matching the customer service I received. Mr. Kenda's easy and professional manner made my experience very positive. He remembered my name and used it within moments of my introducing myself. When explaining the details of our upcoming special event and the type of room I was looking for, he willingly volunteered to show me several rooms that he felt would meet my criteria. I decided to reserve The Executive Suite and Mr Kenda offered a special deal which allowed me to book the adjoining room as well. Anything I asked for was provided including an early check in and late check out allowing the bridal party some extra time to relax. The entire staff at this hotel helped us to make our special event more memorable. We arrived with decorations which the door staff helped us take to the room. The housekeeping staff also assisted by bringing special treats for Saturday night and providing what we needed to clean up before our departure. The hotel was in a perfect location for our event and it provided a clean, classy and comfortable stay. My friends and family wish to thank Mr Kenda and his staff for helping us provide an enjoyable event for the bride, her family and friends. Thank you Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Landry155032
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay, from the bellboy greeting and quick check-in to the spacious room, excellent, fast service and quiet night for a great sleep. Will make it my go-to place for Toronto trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: ShrimmpStarter
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Toronto for a 4-day break and decided to stay with the InterContinental Toronto Yorkville. The location of the hotel is fantastic as it is in closing walking distance to the Metro, the Royal Ontario Museum and the boutique and fashionable stores in the area. We did not have breakfast included in our rate however the hotel is next door to a restaurant called Over Easy which I have to say makes the most amazing breakfasts especially 'the skillet'. Carolina, Evan and James from Concierge were the three employees that stood out the most to us. Evan helped me arrange our car transfers which I would highly recommend as the limo service was a comfortable option after having travelled on a long flight. Carolina highighted the best features of the city which kept us busy and entertained and James also provided us with knowledge about the city as well as local information to get a better understanding of the best things to do in a short amount of time. This involved taking the time to check flight times, train times, sport schedules. Again, we did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants as we normally llke to try local cuisine and explore the city. We ate at a restaurant called Thai Basil which was so delicious and only a 10 minute walk from the hotel as well as at Marche in the Hockey Hall of Fame Building which serves a variety of foods. The best aspects of the hotel were: - location - comfort of the bed - Concierge service - Business centre in order to check emails and flight details with option of printing off ittems - Standard of cleanliness - Quiet hotel Would also recommend going to see Niagra Falls while in Toronto. We took Amtrak from Union Station which was only a 2-hour journey. The only down side which was our own error was that this time of year is exceptionally cold so not too pleasant to get out and about. Definitely need to bundle up!

Reviews.Title: “Urban Oasis in Heart of Downtown - With WONDERFUL service”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler475
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, I (along with my fiance and his parents) had a wonderful stay at the IC Yorkville. It was my first visit to Toronto, and though things didn't go quite as planned, the staff at the hotel took great care of us. The staff was pleasant and went out of their way to meet all of our requests. At the last minute, we asked for adjoining rooms over email, and the request was handled impeccably, as were all of our requests. The rooms were large and airy; we asked for quiet rooms and were not disappointed -- both of our adjoining rooms faced an interior courtyard that looked quite lovely. We made use of the valet parking, which at $35 CDN may seem a bit steep at first blush, but with in and out privileges, is a reasonable alternative to the garage parking that costs $18 dollars. Moreover the service was quick and the bell staff friendly and efficient. Our plan was to spend the day shopping and enjoying Toronto with perhaps a nice dinner thrown in to boot. Unfortunately, I became quite sick, and as one might imagine, plans changed dramatically. We stayed in for much of the trip and and we down-sized our culinary ambitions. As a result, we did not get a chance to sample the hotel's cuisine, though the menu looked interesting. (I should note that my fiance and his parents did seek the assistance of the concierge on several matters, and he was able to help them with all of their needs, which is often a rarity.) A few other notes: the beds were extraordinarily comfy and the housekeepers did an excellent job on our rooms, even offering turndown service. In short, the service here was top-notch! (HDTVs would enhance an otherwise awesome experience!) All in all we had a wonderful stay and would not hesitate to go back; in fact we are planning our next trip in April as we speak and look forward to staying at the IC Yorkville!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here By Choice”
Reviews.Author: Oldtimer55555
Reviews.Content: I was billeted here to attend some interviews, but would normally prefer to stay at the nearby Four Seasons. Although the staff did their best, the place really has the feeling of a down market chain. However, the room rate was very modest.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, helpful staff and very good room”
Reviews.Author: maggie19191919
Reviews.Content: The staff in the dining room and at the front desk were very attentive to our needs, including patient adjustments to our one-year old's adventures with food. When we encountered loud music floating up from the bar late in the evening, we asked that the volume be lowered and it was. My only criticism was that the hotel tv did not have American PBS as one of its offerings and, as a result, we missed a show that we very much wanted to see. The location is superb for what we wanted and we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: patgibson
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure I couldn't have been treated better. I especially commend Sarah and David at the front desk and Hamid and his staff who served our meals, what a great team. On arrival as I came through the door I was greeted with "welcome back Mrs. Gibson" even before I had a chance to give my name (I had been here 2 weeks prior for a week) what a great way to start my stay. Everything from the room environment to the meeting rooms was great, when we found that our room was too crowded the staff went out of their way to readjust the layout and make it more comfortable to finding us another room for our next visit. To staff and management..wonderful place to stay. Sincerely Pat Gibson

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...Not worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: rbp123
Reviews.Content: Great location, but my wife and I were planning on having a nice weekend away without any concerns. Not the case: first the mini-bar didn't work, then the replacement fridge had problems, the duvet cover was put on backwards, the shower head didn't work...and I don't know of many (any?) InterContinental hotels that still have tube tvs in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “An experience worth repeating!”
Reviews.Author: TWI-11
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel we received excellent service: we were greeted cheerfully at the Front Dest; our questions were answered by the concierge and directions provided with helpful hints; excellent service in the restaurant and at the Bar. The room was clean and roomy with amenities thoughtfully provided. The Fitness Center was clean, bright and well organized. A thoroughly enjoyable stay! We look forward to staying there again in our next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a stay in Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: Basilea4056
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at this property on a long term trip (three weeks) to Toronto. The location was perfect for my purposes. The hotel itself is a very clean and nice furnished place. The rooms are spacious and have tables where you can get your work done. Only downside: the charges for the Internet access. In my opinion it should be included in the price of the rooms. The best part of this property is the staff. Always very friendly and most helpful! They really make you feel at home and welcomed. Because of the long stay I had several requests that were not usual. And they always successfully helped me. That's the main factor why I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind loading all your bags onto the trolley and wheeling into the hotel as the doorman had gone awol”
Reviews.Author: airmilesali
Reviews.Content: We arrived with a large amount of luggage as on the road for 2 months. They were happy to tell us at check in it was boutique hotel, after we had unloaded all our bags onto the trolley and pushed into reception without any sign of help from anyone. We were then told we were not allowed to take the trolley to our room as it was the doorman's job. So where was he when we started! The rooms are great and we had a room overlooking the car park at the rear so nice and quiet. They really need to get a grip and realize they would get more customers if they actually provided internet free. Toronto is the only city in the whole of Canada where I have had to pay. I travel to Canada four times each year for over 4 months duration, so for your $10-$15 you miss out on many more nights accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Three strikes . .and you're out!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler1969
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property before and wasn't all too impressed the first time, but thought I'd give it another chance. To put it nicely, after two stays there I've concluded that they really don't know how to service their clients well, especially given their cost. During this particular visit upon check-in, I was greeted with, "sorry we don't have any record of you staying with us" -- Strike 1. I then provided a confirmation number and was told my room was canceled, but they could accommodate me given they had availability. They provided no explanation on why my room was canceled. I later found out from my corp travel department that just the day prior that they personally called to confirm my rate and my room with the hotel directly. The hotel took no accountability for the mix up, but I did get a room. When I did get to my room, it was nice, clean and well appointed, so I thought before going to bed. Luckily I use my cell phone as a back up alarm, which came in handy, because their fancy alarm clock stop working in the middle of the night and wouldn't even turn on in the morning, so it failed to work completely -- Strike 2. After being awoken by my backup alarm, I immediately scrambled to get ready to go to the airport, only to find that there was no hot water in the shower, only in the sink -- needless to say, I had to get creative to get ready and make use of water glasses and warm towels, since the front desk told me it would take 20 minutes for someone to even come to my room to look at it - Strike 3. After using the sink to bathe, I then found a non-working hairdryer in the room, which meant I had to call the front desk again, luckily they got me a working one in 5 minutes. Upon checkout they knew of my dilemma and made absolutely no effort to accommodate me financially or in any other way. The canned response the unhelpful and junior front desk person gave me was, "I am sorry, I will let my manager know this happened." Great, I am sure they're really going to follow up. If you have other hotel options, definitely pursue them. This fancy hotel won't be getting my business or that of my company any longer -- not for the issues I experienced with my room, but as a result of their inability to follow up after the fact, taking accountability and making things right.

Reviews.Title: “Right across the street from Royal Ontario Museum”
Reviews.Author: TaxLoio
Reviews.Content: All of the other reviewers are correct. This hotel is outstanding. The hotel is well appointed and they are very gracious hosts. The hotel is also located right across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum. It was an unexpected treat to be able to see the Terra Cotta warriors while I was in Toronto. The room was very spacious and clean. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: dveksler
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Intercontinental Hotel in Yorkville every week for the past 6 months. After being a road warrior for the past 5 years, this hotel has demonstrated a commitment to excellecence through consistently high service and quality facilities. From the moment you step in the front door, the staff greets you with a smile that makes the challenges of being away from home a little less prevelant. If you find that you want to spoil yourself during an upcoming trip to Toronto with an excellent quality hotel in an incredibly charming part of Town, take me at my word and stay at the Intercontinental-Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, fab, fab”
Reviews.Author: Rhona56
Reviews.Content: We attended a New Year's Eve party with family and friends, including children aged 2-15. We were very impressed and everyone had an awesome time. The food was excellent and the service impeccable. All the employees of the hotel were polite, welcoming and helpful in their roles, which as a guest is always appreciated. We would especially like to thank the staff for their impeccable service on the night of our celebration. Because of them we could relax and enjoy the evening without worrying about anything. We will now be making the Intercontinental our number one hotel when we come to Toronto. Thanks again for making our stay and celebration such a success. Rhona & Martin Smith

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: marymsykes
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its excellent location on Bloor near Yorkville, U of T, and the Royal Ontario Museum without knowing anything about it. Although I was underwhelmed as we pulled up to the curb, once inside, every minute we spent there was an absolute pleasure. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The lobby, hallways, and elevators are tasteful, clean, and cheerful. Our room, despite a king-sized bed, was spacious as was the spotless bathroom with both a tub and separate shower stall. The fitness room and a beautiful pool are located on the top (8th) floor with terrific views of the city. We did not eat in the restaurants. I look forward to staying here again, and I will recommend this boutique hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “I can't stay anywhere else after this...”
Reviews.Author: Midnight_Romeo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Downtown Toronto and I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and for good reason. It is hands down my preferred hotel. Recently (Early December Weekend) I had a formal event to attend and considered trying a different spot; Intercontinental Toronto Centre, (BIG MISTAKE BTW). Long story short after an absurd amount of rudeness from Toronto Centre I canceled all intentions and went over to speak with the Intercontinental Yorkville. Even the way I was treated during the booking alone made me feel like I was nuts for ever picking a different place. Ok now that I've offered somewhat of a backstory, let's get to the details of the Yorkville Intercon on its own. STAFF: TOP NOTCH! I cannot stress this enough, all the staff very pleasant and kind people. I have yet to encounter anyone working here that was not polite or courteous or respectful regardless of the customers status (student or professional, does not matter everyone is treated exceptionally well). They go out of their way to make sure everything goes smoothly and that everyone is satisfied to the best of their ability. The Front Office Manager (Mr. Rolf Kenda) even came out to greet me and ask if there was anything else needing attending (I thought that was a very classy and nice touch). I also want to mention Mr. Park, one of the employees at the front desk, he made the booking of the hotel a no brainer as far as deciding went. These two gentlemen alone definitely saved my Christmas Formal experience. THE ROOM: I stayed in an Executive Suite (got a room upgrade) and it happened to have been the same one I stayed in one of my previous stays. They had also recently renovated it but it still had its classy charm to it. I had a great view of the ROM and the Royal Conservatory of Music building as well as the City view and despite being so close to traffic it was VERY peaceful. The bathrooms were pristine, the sitting room was very cozy, the upgraded Flatscreen in the bedroom was a nice touch, very luxurious all around. I cannot express enough how comfortable their beds are. I generally have trouble sleeping but every time I stay here I literally am out like a light until I need to wake up. Also, all the rooms I've stayed in here (and keep in mind I've stayed to the best of my knowledge in at least 4 different rooms in this hotel), have all been sparkling clean (I've stayed in the Superior to Deluxe to Executive Suites and all rooms adhere to the same standard of cleanliness). THE AMENITIES: Anytime you make a request, they are always very timely with their services. I needed a few glasses and they arrived within minutes, although I don't know when they started charging a delivery fee for them, that must be new because a year ago that was never an issue, but just a small hiccup and hardly a problem. The Pool has a lovely deck with a view if you go out onto the terrace (although I've mostly stayed in winter so that's not really on my list of places to post swimming haha), I ALWAYS make it a point to enjoy the Sauna and Steam Rooms. The Gym was pretty decent although the heaviest dumb bells they had were 50 lbs, but I guess anything heavier and they'd be concerned about people sustaining injuries, but it would have been nice to have been able to push something heavier. Proof Vodka Bar and SkyLounge Patios are a must if you're looking to grab a few drinks. I love the vibe, its trendy, classy, the bartenders are all very competent and friendly (again an ongoing theme at this fine establishment). Also SkyLounge (Spring and Summer) has a really trendy, sexy and romantic vibe to it. A definite must as far as taking a date or spouse for a few drinks and just enjoying the weather. OVERALL / VALUE: It's sad that the idea of "you get what you pay for" isn't a universal truth, but at the Intercontinental Yorkville it truly is and much, much more. Toronto Centre made me want to not renew my Ambassador's Membership after how I was treated but after staying again at the Yorkville Location, I renewed on the spot. I do a fair bit of hotel-ing in Toronto and I figure why not, considering this is more or less my referred location. Every time I stay here, I'm beyond satisfied. When my friends and colleagues ask me to recommend a good hotel downtown, it's really a no-brainer in my opinion. Cheers, hope this helps. -Romeo

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any better....”
Reviews.Author: Shine1919
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the hotel's front door and the first employee that you meet greets you in a friendly and courteous way, you know you've found a 'home away from home'. From that moment on -each and every one of the staff members excelled. We ate several meals in the dining room with each one being outstanding. The breakfast buffet was a delight with lots of fresh fruit, interesting choices of items and a omelet station with many variations. Lunch and dinner menus were equally as refined. Location, location, location = really close to the heart of Toronto, and within walking distance. The rooms were spacious and the bed super comfy, resulting in a sound night's sleep, not to mention the cleanliness which was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: vball61
Reviews.Content: went to toronto for long weekend, from booking to checkin to arrival, the staff led by rolfe at the front desk, the stay was fantastic . there was no problem/issue that rolfe , the concierge ,pretty much any staff member was not willing and ABLE to help with . the hotel was immaculate,amenities great , all packaged in a great downtown location near great shopping, whole foods, starbucks. loved the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stately, generous rooms, quality staff.”
Reviews.Author: alex123HongKong
Reviews.Content: I only stayed two days but it is in a great location, very large rooms (bathroom is the size of most hotel rooms!). And, a very gracious and warm staff. I really recommend it. Jim Crowe

Reviews.Title: “My experience was a bad one with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pamblondie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as I attended a conference. I previously requested an early check-in time which I was told would be available. The request was only for 1 hour earlier than their posted 3:00 p.m. check-in time. When we arrived, our rooms were not ready. They kept saying a few minutes. 2 hours later, I received my room. Others weren't so fortunate. Some rooms were not ready until well after 5:00 p.m. At the conference we were told we could have a late check out because of the check in mishap. They then took their word back and stated we had to check out at the regular time. We valet parked, they lost our key and it took over an hour to get our car! They charged me for things that I didn't take or use from my room, but that was fixed. I would never recommend this hotel. One positive thing: the General Manager was amazing! He is the ONLY one that gets things done. It would be a great loss to that hotel is he left.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: clubmaned
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location as you are perfectly situated in Yorkville where all the best shops are, and the rest of the city is really accessible by cab or the subway which is literally just round the corner. Having stayed in a lot of city center hotels in different cities I was surprised with how spacious the rooms where. The room was clean and well equipped, and the bed super comfy! Check in and out was breeze and for all those vodka lovers out there I would highly recommend the bar as it specializes in vodka. The following morning we had a swim in the pool that overlooks the CN tower. All in all a great stay and will definitely be back the next time I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great to return after 9 years”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: The hotel hasn't changed except for a more modern bar.The rooms are small but well appointed,service is excellent and the food still delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, spotless facilities”
Reviews.Author: RonMD
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on business and chose this hotel for the proximity to the University of Toronto. All staff without exception were genuinely interested, friendly and helpful. The room and health club facilities were spotless ! My only minor issue was that the room was too warm (in November) and the A/C could not be turned on.

Reviews.Title: “just right for a cultural/relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: FrancesOttawa
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the previous reviewer who mentioned seetorontonow.com, we got a very good rate for a weekend getaway at the Intercontinental across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum. Lovely kingsize bed and sitting area. CD player, room safe, iron, and other nice touches in the room (though so-so soap/shampoo/lotion). Swift care from front desk and bellhop, much appreciated when we went back to pick up our luggage just before our flight. We were able to print out our boarding passes from the service computer in the lobby. Steps from the sights we came for, and from the subway. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not my personal choice but a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this hotel because he was attending a conference in the hotel. My preference is for smaller boutique hotels. The location is good if you like to shop high end retail. Holt Renfrew, Prada, Gucci and HÃ©rmes are just down the street with lots of upscale boutiques within a few blocks. (My husband probably wished it wasnâ€™t so easy for me to spend lots of money.) Easier on the wallet shopping at H & M and the Bay is also near by. The Royal Ontario Museum is just across the street if you want a museum to visit which offers lots of variety. Many good and very good restaurants are in the area. Downtown attractions including the CN Tower are further away but can be reached in about half an hour by walking or much faster by taking the nearby subway. It was a $12-15 taxi ride to and from the Four Seasons Performing Arts Centre on a Friday night. The hotel offers the amenities and services expected in a bigger chain which advertises itself as a luxury hotel â€“ restaurant, lounge, room service and a small fitness centre with a lap pool. It has a business centre which must be on the second floor with the conference rooms since I didnâ€™t see it in the lobby. The concierge desk is prominent and the staff in the lobby are quick to ask if you need assistance. I tried the restaurant for dinner and breakfast. The choices are not vast and not cheap but the food and service were good. The lounge is very expensive but in the evening was full of lively younger people who didnâ€™t seem to be put off by the cost of drinks. Our room, a deluxe king, was very roomy with a sitting area as well as a work desk. The bathroom done in marble has both a tub and separate shower and was spacious and very clean. In room coffee or tea was complimentary as was the small safe. A cash mini bar and snack tray was also offered. The room and bed were comfortable and quiet as the windows faced an inner courtyard and we were able to leave the window cracked open during the night for fresh air. All the housekeeping staff we encountered were very friendly and did a very good job maintaining the room. The hotel is getting a bit dated in some ways. The room we had did not have a flat screen television so common in many hotels now and the two elevators were very slow. Internet connection, not wi-fi, was available in the room but at a cost of $11 per day, when most places now offer internet for free. All in all, my complaints are minor. I would not dissuade anyone from staying here. However, I doubt I would stay again. If I was in Toronto for pleasure, I would prefer to be further south in the downtown area where there are a number of good boutique hotels and closer to more art galleries, theatres and performing arts centres.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: RandJ0806
Reviews.Content: I like to preface reviews by saying that I work in the luxury travel industry. So I know that I am nit picky. I also know that if I worked in a different field, it is likely I wouldn't notice some of the things I do. When I was in Toronto for work last year (and at an amazing hotel that unfortunately wasn't available this time), I fell in love with Yorkville. The location of the Intercontinental is its best asset. The hotel's prime spot on Bloor Street makes it worth it - I love the quaintness of Cumberland and the diversity of Yongue Street. The metro is around the corner. I also discovered an amazing bikram studio virtually next door which only enhanced my stay further, especially after a long trade show. (If you like yoga this is one of the most beautiful studios I've ever seen!!) The marble clad lobby looks as though it could do with a renovation. The condition is fine, but the gold accents makes it look a bit dated. My room was inconsistent and one of the strangest I've been in for awhile. The desk chair was significantly chipped and as others have said, the TVs aren't flat screen - the later of which isn't a big deal to me, though I was surprised to see the power button didn't work (remote was fine) and the screen made a buzzing sound at times. The bathtub had a chip/crack in it, although not a big enough deal not to use it. The room looked like it was missing furniture. There was a huge open space that was clearly in need of something and across from the empty spot was a wicker lounge that looked like it was meant for a patio. I'm guessing that at one point there was a couch in the space which must've been needed elsewhere but instead of replacing it, a piece of misplaced furniture landed there. I was surprised there weren't any bathrobes in the rooms, as that is the norm for 4 and 5 star hotels. I also didn't sleep well, though the bed looks like a dream. I thought perhaps the troubles my first night were due to the event I had the following day but even post event, I couldn't sleep through the night. I never have trouble sleeping while at hotels so I'm not sure what the problem was. The hotel directory states that 24 hour room service is available, but if you take a closer look at the menu, in actuality it is from 6 or 6:30am to 11:30 or midnight. I didn't order room service so I can't speak about its quality. Service elsewhere was good. Reception is happy to answer your questions and loans out umbrellas on rainy days. There is a $30 charge if these are not returned. Unfortunately mine got lost at the trade show I was attending, but the hotel kindly voided the charge. I didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant - I recommend Shogun on Cumberland very highly! But if you don't like Japanese, I would suggest a walk along Youngue Street where the options on offer are endless. Really good bubble tea there. I also followed someone else's recommendation from here and had breakfast at Over Easy, which is next door. Yum! Pick this place for its location. That makes up for where the hotel itself falls short.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: markcarla
Reviews.Content: My wife and i only spent one night here but the staff, service and room where all great. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but not stuffy”
Reviews.Author: jennylaika
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had a great experience. The beds and bedding were fantastic and the staff were very helpful and personable. The gym is small but very well equipped. The smoked salmon omelette on the breakfast menu should not be missed. In addition, the food in the lounge was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “super break in september”
Reviews.Author: sonapaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and were very impressed by the friendly service of all the hotel staff, superb rooms and excellent breakfast. Location great just opposite the Royal Ontario Museum and famous Bloor street with many shops, boutiques etc. Concierge recommended excellent restaurants within walking distance, our stay in this hotel was a real treat. Pool super for teenagers. Definitely coming back when again in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grinch99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in September and have nothing but the highest praise for this hotel. The standards throughout are very high with lovely rooms & public areas as well as friendly, helpful & courteous staff, who always took time to take an interest in you. The hotel itself is situated away from the main tourist attractions downtown but the nearest subway is 2 minutes away so you can soon be in the centre of things. We didnt eat breakfast in the hotel as there are cheaper options nearby with the breakfast restaurant Over Easy 2 doors away & Tim Hortons on the corner. In the evenings, we also ate locally with 3 good options on Prince Arthur St, right behind the hotel. Would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and service.”
Reviews.Author: cpnichols
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Toronto right at the peak of the Toronto International Film Festival, which I did not realize at the time. The hotel was fully booked with many VIPs and celebrities. I never noticed any stress or tension on any of the staff, or the quality of my stay. I was treated extremely well, the staff even remembered my name at many occasions. If this is how I am treated at their busiest time, I can't wait to visit there again during a more standard week. The hotel is not too big either which makes the stay a bit more personal with a 5 star service. I also enjoyed the hotel bar which was very relaxed yet sophisticated, and had some great food as well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Weekend in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: newyorker4ever2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Toronto Tourist Association as a package deal bundled with the Royal Ontario Museum. It was an amazing deal. Definitely check their website www.seetorontonow.com before booking anywhere else. The InterContinental Toronto Yorkville is in the most fantastic location. It's literally across the street from the ROM and in a posh retail area. Self-parking is around the corner and is connected to the hotel. My first impression, upon seeing the lobby, was that it was sleek and upscale However, after seeing the old tube style TV in the console in our room, that feeling was gone. I'm aware that there are plans to change the old style TV and console to a flat screen but why the delay? Flat screen TVs have been around for years. The bathroom too could use a renovation. I've stayed at other InterContinental Hotels and they are far newer in feel. Service was wonderful. Since we found this wonderful package, it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller6
Reviews.Content: I travel on business quite frequently and am part of the Intercontinental Ambassador program. I also belong to the Starwood frequent guest program. I have stayed at multiple hotels in Toronto on multiple occasions but I keep going back to the Intercontinental on Yorkville. You cannot beat the location. Period. The rooms I have gotten tend to be larger and better appointed than most in the city, unless of course you are staying at the Four Seasons. I have been treated very well, and now, with my daughter attending the local University, I will be going back quite often. Great resturants and things to do (the Museum is right across the street). Try Pusateri's! Congratulations to the staff and the management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mols0n
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant experience at this hotel for a quick get-away. The suite was nice along with the bathroom and is great location.

Reviews.Title: “Felt rumble of subway”
Reviews.Author: SYHighlander
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant, staff is friendly, good location to subway but........the rumble below was disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, great location, but they need to be clear on policies”
Reviews.Author: Cucidate
Reviews.Content: Our party had two rooms on the 4th floor. We asked for quiet rooms and were very happy with our assigned rooms. They overlooked the back parking lot and the gardens of houses on the next street. Actually a nice view. It was very quiet. No road noise at all. Our room was spacious and had a nice bay window. Furnishings looked a bit tired, but well kept. Staff service was very good and quick to respond to requests. Although we enjoyed our stay , we weren't happy learning after the fact, that they have a policy of charging an additional $100 to one's credit card as a security deposit. After a few phone calls, they assured me that they re-imburse or eliminate the charge after checking the room over. I would have wanted to know about this policy when I checked in, rather than once I returned home.

Reviews.Title: “Overhyped hotel with few extras”
Reviews.Author: planetraincar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel on Bloor Street for two nights last week. While typically a very expensive hotel, I managed to get a last-minute reservation through Priceline for approximately $125 per night, which I consider a bargain. Having stayed a few times at the Intercontinental in downtown Toronto on Front Street, Iâ€™ve wanted to stay out at the Bloor Street/Yorkville location, as itâ€™s a much-hyped hotel. Donâ€™t get me wrong, this is a very nice hotel. At $125 a night, it was a grand bargain, however, I donâ€™t believe itâ€™s worth the regular, non-Priceline rate. Parking is expensive, but thatâ€™s to be expected in Toronto. I opted for valet parking, as it was only a couple dollars more than self-parking and it came with unlimited entries and departures from the garage across the street. I was extremely disappointed with the rather expensive internet, which should be complimentary if you are paying a couple hundred dollars a night as many guests pay. Several other extras â€“ turn-down service stands out â€“ that typically come were missing. I also found the in-room amenities lacking for a hotel of this grade. Only two towels were provided, and they were very rough to the feel and cheap. There was no bathrobe provided, and the toiletries were just the standard offerings. I was opening they would have a higher grade of toiletry offerings. The queen bed itself was spacious and comfortable, but the pillows were horrible. Lighting in the hallway and room could be improved, especially in the rooms. The dÃ©cor was befitting of Bloor Street, but it was ruined by a television from the Ancient Regime. The service was prompt and friendly. The concierge was very accommodating when called upon. I was satisfied with a dinner recommendation that he made, but wished he would have advised it was in the gay neighborhood. My only poor experience was departure when I left an expensive battery charger for my digital SLR camera in the room. I called the hotel four times. The first time I was put on hold by the operator and waited for 10 minutes without anyone picking up.
