The second time I called the concierge and he called me promptly looked into it and reported no charger was found. I found this hard to believe and called back and spoke with the manager-on-duty. She promised to look into the matter, but never called me back. The fourth time I called and spoke with another manager-on-duty. He was very understanding, but after an hour or so reported that the director of housekeeping himself couldnâ€™t find the missing charger. I assured him that I left it in the room and even provided an exact location. The logical conclusion is that a hotel maid took the item and failed to report it. Sadly, this happens probably at all hotels. And now for some positives, the hotelâ€™s location is outstanding. While itâ€™s a tad removed from downtown Toronto and the Financial District, itâ€™s within walking distance of the cityâ€™s best shopping as well as major sightseeing stops such as Queenâ€™s Park (the Ontario Legislature) and the Royal Ontario Museum. The concierge advised me to take the subway or a taxi for further destinations, but I donâ€™t mind walking and spent most of my time on the city streets walking all the way to the Rogers Centre and Harbourfront. All in all, I had an enjoyable stay that would been better with a few improvements. If you can secure a reasonable rate, I would recommend the Intercontinental on Bloor Street. Otherwise, I think you can find a better hotel at a better price in the Financial District if youâ€™re visiting Toronto at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Violet_and_Jeff
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel is an Intercontinental [with all the positives that entails] it is small enough to make it personal and boutique-like. Having stayed here over many years, it has been consistently excellent. The location could not be better - close to shops, subway etc. Friendly and helpful staff, in all areas of the hotel, make for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Holls33
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute and took a package deal for 495/night. Pretty steep, but it included breakfast each day, tickets to the Bata Shoe Museum (sounds boring, but really cool, especially the 3rd floor exhibit), tickets on the hop on/hop off bus ($77), and valet parking each day ($35/day ouch). So we figured out that we actually got a better deal than the $395/night. We also were given a room upgrade to the executive suite which was very nice. We had two bathrooms and a living/dining room separate from the bedroom. It is in need of some minor updating and one of those spring cleanings that gets every nook and cranny. I have OCD so.....I notice things that most won't. My husband was in heaven so I never mentioned it. Ha Ha! Overall it's very nice. You are right across the street from the ROM, which has a great restaurant C5 which I'll also review(great). Nice walk through the University of Toronto campus as well as Queens Park. Not far from Casa Loma. You can walk there, but it will take you about 20 minutes. If you like high end shopping then this is the area for you. All the designers have a store in the area and some very unique boutiques as well. The skylounge is very nice and the chips they serve there are amazing! There is a good deal of construction going on in the area. If you are used to big cities this shouldn't bother you. It didn't bother us at all. The only downside here is that I asked the concierge to find out about movie tickets, and some other things and never got a return call. Either they are forgetful, or overwhelmed. I'm not sure. I wasn't annoyed enough to complain, but the service that should accompany a $500/nt room should be stellar. Overall I'd recommend the hotel. I wouldn't stay here again, just because I like a change each time I stay somewhere. I would recommend it though

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjjc
Reviews.Content: I highly reccomend the InterContinental Yorkville for anyone looking for a hotel in great location with fabulous customer service. From the moment you arrive, the people at the front desk are welcoming and helpful. The rooms are quiet, comfortable and clean.The breakfast in the hotel restaurant is terrific. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: IaOrana_Maruuruu
Reviews.Content: This hotel has eight floors - a lap pool and a sauna on the top floor. Rooms are clean, well appointed and up-to-date, although TV's are out of place by being curiously NOT state of the art. Parking is convenient enough (although not part of the hotel) and reasonably priced for downtown Toronto. Rooms had fabric walls, dark wood panelling in main corridors, elegant fixtures. From the check-in, to room service, to cleaning staff, to the restaurant staff - all were excellent. Excellent means efficient and polite. Particularly good was Keren working in the restaurant. The hotel is particularly good value if you are an Ambassador member. It lives up to its reputation. Only criticism: way too much chlorine in the pool, although this seems to be the norm in Canadian hotels I've stayed in. The Intercontinental Toronto Center (which is on Front Street) is NO WHERE NEAR as good as this one. Web-site is not very good, but this is a chain-wide weakness.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: b0tanical7
Reviews.Content: The intercontinental is in a great location in yorkville, and is a great hotel for the price. The concierge Carolina is wonderful for ideas. The rooms are a good size and very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ElaineR75
Reviews.Content: I just found out about this site and wanted to make to share with all my experiences at this hotel. In a nutshell they offer the best customer service in each of their depts and my last trip, Rolf Kenda, Front Office Mgr, corrected a mistake I made and set everything right with a smile and just a fantastic attitude

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not Great”
Reviews.Author: prariegirlWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel had some of the friendliest staff that I have ever encountered!! I found the room to be reasonably cleaned, but for the class of hotel there were a lot of nicks and big gauges in the furniture. The bed was comfortable but my travel companions found it much too soft. They woke up with sore backs. The duvets were a great touch. The bathroom was very big but really needed a fan. The room had a 32 inch tube TV and even lower budget hotels now have LCD. I didn't like the fact that there was no free wifi as again lower budget hotels have for free. I found a great deal on Hotwire and found the price that I paid worth it, but I would never stay here if I paid what they quoted me on their website. Another downside is that the carts full of dirty dishes remained outside of the rooms for a long time. Something like that should really be picked up a lot sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Tired & Poorly Managed”
Reviews.Author: OftenTravelling
Reviews.Content: No coffee in the room with the coffee maker. Early departure, so, no coffee. In-room safe locked from previous guest, so, no in-room safe. No Kleenex in the bathroom, but, there was an empty Kleenex box cover on the counter. The single-ply toilet paper is beneath the standard of most gas stations. Pole lamp in the corner of the room could only be controlled by the wall switch; the dimmer switch on the lamp was broken. Clock radio not set and blinking, so, no alarm without wake-up call. Bathrobes, available, apparently, But only "on request", which is weird in a hotel charging $300+ a night. Enquired on arrival if a second night might be available in case trip needed to be extended. Was dismissed with the fully booked story. Checked on Expedia when I got to the room and was able to book the second night, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: endtry
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, friendly staff, and clean room, breakfast is wonderful, Front Desk staff friendly and helpful and they help me everything i need. Good loacation

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: ABinTO
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel and again it was great. Early check-in, bright and clean room and friendly staff. It remains our hotel of choice in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing uptown property, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Shores84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends in February 2010. The hotel truly was amazing in terms of location, decor, service and amenities. I booked through Hotwire and was able to get a good deal on the room ($99 per night!). The hotel was located on Bloor Street and surrounded by all the top, high-end stores (Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Holt Renfrew, etc.), as well as the Royal Ontario Museum right across the street. There was also a subway station nearby. The lobby of the hotel was small, but check-in was quick and efficient. The decor was luxurious and elegant, but not over the top. I really liked the service in this hotel. They were quick to respond to any request that I or my friends had made. I had brought some food which I would like warmed, and they microwaved it for me (they did charge $3 for warming though as tips, but it was not a problem for me). Finally, the best part of this hotel was their indoor swimming pool located on the top floor. This amenity truly was the icing on our stay, and you must make sure not to miss it! The pool was adjacent to the fitness room and relatively small in size, but the water was comfortably warm and you could see the skyline of Toronto with the CN Tower on the horizon. After a dip in the pool, we also enjoyed their steamroom and hot spa - both located in the same area as the swimming pool. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and truly recommend this property to anyone wishing to visit Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Everything great except for the stray hairs”
Reviews.Author: meyww
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights while on vacation and really enjoyed being here. The first night we checked in, the room seemed decent, until we started to climb into bed. I pulled back the sheets on the bed and noticed a lot of stray hairs all over. We immediately called down to the front desk and we were promptly given a new room. No complaints after that. The staff were always very helpful, kind, and accommodating. In the evenings, there is always a tray of fresh apples at the front desk for your taking. The subway was very close by (just around the corner) and Bloor Street had a lot of restaurants on it within walking distance. The gym was small, but had a few treadmills and weights - sufficient for the quick workout. Each bathroom is spacious and has a shower and a separate tub. The towels were large and fluffy and the beds were so comfy! We slept in every day! The only gripe was that they were doing construction on Bloor Street near all the high end stores, so anyone coming to pick us up or drop us off took a while to drive down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Greensmaster
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms. Both were immaculate. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom had all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: MortyCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a Friday and Saturday night, with the second night complimentary with purchase of Ambassador status. Physical location: The hotel is located across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum, and that was one of the reasons for choosing it. This is a relatively small hotel with very little parking to be found in the area. We valeted the car at a nightly cost of $35. There is no driveway/dropoff area; you simply pull up to the front of the hotel when there is a small parking area that is kept clear. The nearby area is dotted with fastfood chain restaurants (McDonalds, Tim Hortons, etc.) Since we were busy visiting museums, we did not venture out to sample the local fare. Physical: The hotel has an on-site restaurant and a bar that serves food. We were upgrade to a spacious studio suite that had a comfortable sitting area and a king bed. The roomy marble bath had a smallish shower and seperate tub. The room was clean and seemed to have mostly new Rattan furntiure. The TV was somewhat small and old. A smallish swinning pool and fitness room are located on the 8th floor. Adequate but little more. Wire and wireless interest are available at a cost of about $12 for 24 hours. Service: The room was serviced daily with a turn down service in the evening. Our only extended contact was with the valet/bellman, who we found friendly and accomodating. Food. We are an evening dinner in the restaurant. The fixed price menu offered three choices of which we tried two and found to be very good. The menu offers three courses and a different wine for each course for $50, which we though to be quite reasonable. The waiter was very accomodating, and since we were the only people in the restaurant, we received ample attention. We ordered a dinner from room service and found one of the two choices to be absolutely terrible. I complained and the waiter brough complimentary deserts when he came to fetch the trolley. A nice touch. A complimentary Continetial breakfast we quite meager, but then it was free. We will likely choose this hotel again when we visit the ROM. If we are attending a theatre or visiting the Art Gallery of Ontario, we will likely choose the HIlton, which is much more conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monument
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly at all times. The room was large clean with a decent en-suite bathroom with bath and shower. Only ate in the Vodka bar which was well staffed with friendly girls who took time to help with advice on sightseeing, local restaurants and shopping venues. The area is up market so expect to pay a little more in restaurants and bars than in the downtown area. Downtown is only a couple of stops on the underground or a 20-30 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at the InterContinental Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: Agnes_Pierre
Reviews.Content: What a treat to stay at the InterContinental Yorkville! Elegant surroundings, classy rooms, sumptuous bedding, windows that open, and especially refined, client-centric approach.

Reviews.Title: “A treat to stay at while on a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: hairygal
Reviews.Content: Your renovations rocked. Rooms were beautiful and comfortable. Will definitely come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to staying again”
Reviews.Author: timber9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay with the InterContinental Yorkville. We found it very central for the all the sightseeing we planned on doing while visiting Toronto. The staff were very polite, helpful and made us feel that no question was a stupid one. We also noticed the people working at this hotel always smiled and were very friendly. The rooms were tastefully decorated, quiet and clean. The bed was very comfortable and we were not bothered by any outside noises at all and slept very well. Our favorite in regards to this hotel were definately the staff and the restaurant. Our least is very hard to say, I suppose they could put a few more towels in the bathrooms. We will go again and I have already told alot of our friends about our positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best stay we've had.”
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th or 5th time at the Intercontinental Yorkville. Normally we run into a snag or two while we stay here. The snags are usually minor, which is why we are repeat customers. This past stay was a weekend in February. We got a great rate on Hotwire, and were pleased with our room initially. On the Friday night as we were trying to sleep, all we could hear through the windows was loud music from the nightclub below. I think this may be the first time I've stayed on the courtyard side of the hotel, hence why I've never noticed before. It was so loud until after midnight, we could not sleep. Also, we were annoyed by this intermittent sound from the vent or ductwork that resembled an airplane landing in our room. It only lasted about 10 or 15 seconds, but happened about 3 or 4 times an hour, making it a long night of tossing and turning. A call to the front desk revealed they had no alternative room to put us in, which they cannot control, I guess, if they are sold out of our room type. Even for the cheap price we paid, we were disappointed. This hotel is in a fantastic location, in one of the nicest parts of Toronto. Easy subway access,Tim Hortons and Starbucks near by, lots of shopping and restaurants. If you are going to park, use the self parking around the corner on Bedard Street. It was 30 dollars for 2 days parking, instead of 30 plus a night for valet. Also, the underground area of the parking lot has access to the hotel elevators. Overall, not a terrible experience, yet I've had better stays here, and at other nearby hotels. If we could have been accommodated by staff, it may have made it a little better for us, and more comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to others, only if you get an excellent rate via Hotels.com, Priceline, etc. I will likely choose a different hotel on our next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Tourist or Event hotel â€“ solid location and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: Had another event in Toronto, so stayed at the Intercontinental Yorkville for the evening. As previous posters noted, the Intercontinental Yorkville is well-situated on Bloor Street, near the Yorkville shopping district, the Royal Ontario Museum, and the Royal Conservatory of Music. Itâ€™s central, steps away from a major subway line, and in a good, safe neighbourhood. If you have business in the Financial District, this is a bit out of the way (likewise for concerts/games at the Air Canada Centre and the Rogers Centre), and I would probably choose a different hotel (such as the other Intercontinental). But if youâ€™re here on leisure travel or for an event (like the Film Festival), and donâ€™t have a car, you canâ€™t do much better than this. This is a modestly-sized (less than 10 floors) boutique-hotel, that meets Intercontinental standards (though it isnâ€™t anything special). Rooms were clean, modern, with fresh facilities (LCD TV, clean bathroom facilities). Hallways are neat and proper, and decorated in a classical style. The fitness facility has a decent size, and the pool area has a view of the CN tower. Rooms that face Bloor Street have a better view of the city (and possibly the CN tower, depending on the floor), but Bloor street gets pretty frequent taxi and garbage truck traffic in the early morning. There is also a condominium being constructed next door (December 2009), but it looks like the exterior is finishing up. If visiting, and had a good deal/Pricelining this hotel, Iâ€™d strongly recommend this. Itâ€™s one of the top chain hotels in Toronto. This is a very busy TIFF (film festival) gathering point, and deservedly so. Youâ€™re on the northern edge of what would be considered â€œdowntownâ€�, but youâ€™re still a short distance from all the action.

Reviews.Title: “This is our favourite hotel in Toronto - great service, beautiful rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jayceyWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy staying at this hotel and we have been here many times. The service is excellent, - the staff are friendly, courteous and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The fitness facilities are just right. The location is perfect - in the heart of Toronto and close to great shopping, restaurants, the Royal Ontario Museum, and the University of Toronto. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Response to Complaints! You should say here.”
Reviews.Author: Pakse
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel - I had an issue; the package rate I booked included breakfast and I was unhappy with how the breakfast was handled. The hotel listened to my complaint - invited me back - promised to fix things. They really did fix things - the staff really did go out of their way to remedy the issue. The rooms are nice, quiet and an excellent space. The staff is really exceptional. Now when I pull up I know from the valet to the front desk - everything will be handeled with the utmost care, curtosy and respect. I have come to really enjoy my stays here at the IC Yorkville. The pool is wonderful if you are a swimmer - the workout area is nice. As an RA - I have to admit that it it's tough sometimes to choose - the IC Toronto Town Center has a wonderful club lounge and a stunning salt water pool...but the staff at Yorkville do pull me away when business has me on the Yorkville side of town. Love the hotel - can't say enough about it's staff. All hotels have problems - the truly great ones deal with and fix their issues - like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: lwadamlw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights during the week after Christmas. The staff was very professional and formal. The room itself was clean and nicely appointed. It was well maintained, but by no means seemed newâ€”will need updating soon. Oddly, there the room was missing robes (not a big deal, but expected in this price range). The pool is only a lap poolâ€”there is no hot tub. The hotel was very pricey for extras, such as phone calls, internet etcâ€”even more so than I expected. The location is goodâ€”right across from the Royal Ontario Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Always a guaranteed great stay”
Reviews.Author: Angela_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times and I always seem to remark what a great stay it is. The hotel is decorated in a simple elegant style as are the rooms. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms are very large on the whole with plenty of towels and toiletries. I always order a rope as the rooms does not come with one, they are quick on service though. The coffee is also of note, a very popular high street name. The beds are absolutely heaven, like a cloud, perhaps that's why I'm always so upbeat when I leave. The location for shoppers could not be better, it is in the middle of all names big and small in retail. This location is fantastic. Parking can be a hassle, let the hotel park your car, it's worth it, if not use the public lot behind the hotel and don't move, the lot is full every night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cmacjef
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Intercontinental on several occassions. The location in the center of Toronto is superb and the staff is always professional, polite and eager to assist. This most recent visit, our room faced north which I preferred as there was less road noise. The south facing rooms allow a nice view of down town, the new conservatory building and the 'crystal'. There is a nice work out room, sauna and pool. Also a lovely roof top patio if you are staying in good weather.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - Just like being at home”
Reviews.Author: mobber
Reviews.Content: Easy to find. The staff were very accommodating - when our rooms were not ready, you quickly made other arrangements so we did not have to wait. My "king" room was spacious & welcoming. I was surprised to find a separate shower stall in the bathroom & plenty of shelf space. For a conference facility, the service & food was amazing. The coleslaw at dinner was the best I had ever had. The desserts & fresh fruit were unbelievable! The breakfast was perfect - yougurt, fresh fruit & bagels. I am looking forward to the conference next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from An Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: suncinwong
Reviews.Content: The location was great -- right across from the Royal Ontario Museum. The hotel was rated as 4 stars, but reality was not quite, but not bad. The worst part of the stay was that I had requested a non-smoking room with 2 beds. I called ahead to confirm the arrangements, and was told everything was in place. When I checked in, the person at the front desk said "I see you have a non smoking room with 2 beds", and proceded to assign a room to me. When I got there, the room WREAKED of cigarette smoke, and there were ashtrays everywhere. When I spoke to the person at the front desk, he did not apologize, and simply replied "oh, well you wanted 2 beds and that's all we had left". I told him "you could have at least told me this, so I could make a choice about whether or not I would be willing to take a smoking room. Again, he did not even apologize.I asked for a manager and was changed to a non-smoking room with 1 bed, and an added rollaway. Doubtful that I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Crispin_C
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights here in August. All the staff we encountered were very nice and helpful at all times. Got breakfast included (in Signatures) with our booking which was very nice - waiter service and a nice selection made a change from the usual buffet that you normally get. Having said that if you want to save some cash, McDonalds is next door, as is another breakfast cafe and a Coffee Cup (like Starbucks) so you have some options. There is building work going on next door, but there was no noise or disruption day or night when we were there so I wouldn't worry about it. Location is ideal for the ROM (over the road) and the tour buses stop outside it. I would definitely check out Hemingway's on Cumberland Road for very reasonable food or a drink. It looks small on the outside, but had a great terrace just at the top - go in and straight up the stairs. To get there (walking), turn left out of the hotel, turn left at the lights and take the first road on the right (across the road) it's basically behind the 4 seasons hotel. There are a few other bars and restaurants along there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good room in a central location”
Reviews.Author: purplespud
Reviews.Content: Excellent sized room with only slightly tired furnishings. Good location for access to subway or to start off on foot. Staff was superb. Is just shy of it's 4 star rating. If you are on business or a shopper then location is likely optimal. If you like night life, you will need to travel ever so slightly as there is nothing much going on in that neighbourhood but with subway and taxis it is no big deal. In house bar is your generic well appointed but overpriced hotel bar, no life or energy though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...just not quite what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Jackand7
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel at a fantastic rate through another web site. I had hoped to get a different Intercontinental location which happens to be right next door to Roger's Center but got this one instead. I was travelling with my elderly father and he has some mobility issues so being closer to Roger's was preferrable. We were in Toronto for two nights to catch a Blue Jays/Yankees game which was a highlight because my dad is a Jays nut! We arrived at the hotel only to find that our room was not ready and would not be for another hour. This posed a problem because my father was tired after the flight and wanted to rest and friends had also arrived to take me to Niagara Falls. So not being able to get my Dad into our room and also not wanting to make my friends wait put my in a bit of a bind. Gaby, who was a trainee at the front desk, stepped up and sorted things out. She told me to go ahead with my friends to enjoy the trip to Niagara and that she would personally escort my Dad to our room once it was ready and then she would call me to let me know that he was safe and sound. Very nice service...and she delivered. I was definitely worried but once I got the call from her, she told me that he was fine and then transferred the call to the room so I could talk to him. I was very appreciative of that. She also upgraded us to a deluxe room for the inconvenience. The rooms are very nice with large bathrooms. Very comfortable over all. My only complaints here would be the shower which had black mould on the ceilings once I turned the light inside the stall on day 2! I didn't see it the first time I showered in there. The only other complaint would be the noise that comes up from the ground floor if you have a room with a courtyard view, which we did. Our first night was a Saturday and the main floor has a vodka bar which seems to be quite the trendy, hopping place. I didn't check it out because I didn't pack appropriate clothing for that type of evening. It can be a bit noisy. On the Sunday night, there was a wedding reception which was even noisier! But all in all, it made for some great people-watching...and you CAN see right into the rooms across the courtyard! My 76 year old father happened to catch some interesting views during the afternoon I was away! He was embarrassed but I thought that was hilarious! The hotel has the lounge and a fine restaurant, but I was plenty happy having some beers and some pretty decent food at the pub located just down the street. There is also a Subway, McDonald's and a pretty busy breakfast place all located right beside this pub...and all of these are across the street from the ROM (which most unfortunately, I didn't have time to go visit). There is also a Tim Horton's just down Bloor Street in the opposite direction. So your food choices are decent if the hotel restaurant is not your style. The fitness center is nice with good equipment, a steam room and a sauna. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the pool since it was a lap pool that was very narrow and only 3 feet deep so I had to wait until the two people that were in there finished using it. There is only room for two people to swim comfortably. Obviously being on the top floor only allows for a certain size pool, but the pictures I saw made it look a lot bigger than it was. The outdoor patio was very nice since I went out there late one night to enjoy the beautiful night sky and the weather. Transportation (taxi) to Roger's Center cost $11 to the game and $15 on the way back since traffic was heavier. More than acceptable and better since they dropped us off at the front gate which minimized walking for my Dad. The taxi to the airport EARLY on Monday morning of a holiday weekend cost $57 with next to no traffic. If you are taking a cab to the airport at ANY other time, ask for the flat rate which will be $55. I figured we could do better than that considering the time we were leaving, but no such luck. As others have stated, the subway is very close which gives you another option to get around. The only reason that I said the hotel was not what I expected was because when I told my friends in TO that I was staying there, they said it was an amazing hotel that all the celebrities stay at when in town. I have been fortunate enough to stay in those type of hotels before (5 Star) and this just wasn't one of those. It is truly a four star hotel. That being said, the service was excellent, the rooms were very comfortable and I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Vacation”
Reviews.Author: darcy4u
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. Very nice spacious and clean room, very good, central location in Toronto which was very close to the TTC and downtown Toronto. As well it was quiet and more intimate than most hotels I've stayed at. I very happy with the customer service and I would highly recommend going back to this hotel anytime

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: buttery
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room here for out-of-town guests, and subsequently helped them check in and spent a few hours each day visiting with them in their room. Service at the front desk was friendly and efficient. The staff were consistently helpful when asked, and we never felt neglected, but this isn't a place where they scurry to assist with baggage or parking. If you desire or expect that kind of immediate, hands-on service, then there are other hotels in the area that might be more suitable. My request for a quiet room, away from elevators and the seemingly endless condo construction on Bloor Street was respected, and that's what mattered to me. The room itself was spacious and furnished in a tasteful, modern way - with good quality linens on the bed (and a mohair throw in bold orange for a stylish touch!), contemporary art on the walls, comfortable chairs, and a fairly large marble bathroom. The location of the hotel is excellent, almost directly across from the ROM (Royal Ontario Museum), a block away from the Gardiner Ceramics Museum, and half a block from two subway lines. The only possible downsides: even on the sixth floor, we could sometimes hear the subway (TTC) trains; I'm not sure if the sound varies with weather or braking speed or what, but we were hearing them only occasionally, and they were faint, like the rumble of distant thunder. Even so, if you're very sensitive to noise, then this might bother you. The other thing I noticed was that the shower (separate from the bath) was on the small side, not so much as to be bothersome for the average person, but it might not be comfortable for some who require more space. Nonetheless, with some very good rates available online (especially for advance purchase), this is one of the best choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond service!”
Reviews.Author: ktimene
Reviews.Content: Above and beyond service at the InterContinental (especially on the parts of John-Paul and David). I'll get to that after I rave on the other features. - Convenient to Yorkville -- all the restaurants and shops within a 5 min walk. - Spectacular view of ROM architecture - Indulgent PILLOW selection. I had 7 pillows of varying firmness, all with very pretty French matellase cotton pillowcases! And a featherbed that had me floating in the heavens. - Background on the amazing service rating: friends were visiting TO from NYC, and had the misfortune of leaving a passport on the plane. This dawned on said friend on the Sunday morning before departure. The front desk and the concierge desk were like SHERLOCK and WATSON, calling Pearson, Montreal, Air Canada-- even Canada and US customs!!! All was done with complete professionalism and empathy. Let's face it-- losing the passport is irresponsible but the team there made it a significantly less shameful-- and stressful-- event. They even printed out application forms and helped us secure an appt at the US embassy for the next day. Today the hotel emailed us confirming that the passport showed up a customs (We had it already), but what a gesture!! - Also, compared to the Park Hyatt and the Hazelton, the prices for the suite were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Big, anonymous but quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wabamik
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its excellent location on Bloor St. Staggered in from street with heavy bags tired after intercontinental flight; no doorman available to help. Reception staff smiled but did not ask if we required assistance. Not a good start. Upgraded to a smart suite but an incongruous single bed was upturned in the middle of sitting room. Great having two loos and two enormous tellies for those who can't miss it. Quality room very comfortable but as you would expect for the price. Service in the terrace bar outside was charming but a bit hit and miss. We didn't eat there, it looked as anonymous as rest of place but there is a an amazing all day breakfast place called 'Over Easy' two doors down which we recommend for a heart attack breakfast. This is a good business hotel for those who want quiet luxury and anonymity. It's not an ideal holiday place. Needless to say when we left we staggered out with our own bags again, the smiling door man helpfully holding the doors open while we struggled. I doubt we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: CDNmaven
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in Toronto, but never the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville. We were a family group that reserved several rooms for a family weekend celebration. From the onset our stay was perfect. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted by the doorman and our check -in was equally effecient and extremely friendly. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. We loved the large bathroom with seperate shower stall. The comfy beds made for a great sleep! We will be re-visiting the Intercontinental Toronto Yorkville very soon. We loved the smaller size of this hotel which lended itself to superb service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay due to the helpful staff & pleasing, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: TripKingston
Reviews.Content: We were not sure where to stay in order to be close to where I was having eye surgery. The staff on the phone when I was inquiring about the location etc was pleasant and interested in our requirements. We were very pleased with our room and it was so comfortable. We will be going back to stay again. The nice note welcoming us was appreciated as well.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous visit To The Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: ecade
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding as we love to shop and dine at Yonge and Bloor. The service at the hotel was friendly and attentive. Our rooms were clean comfortable and very attractive. Our whole experience was lovely. We will return again next year. This is our 4th trip here as a group, at least. For myself, I rarely stay any where else. Thank you to Robyn and the front desk staff for going the extra mile, one more time! Elizabeth Cade

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, upscale hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Lovemytravels11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend getaway to Toronto (our first time). Choosing a hotel in a city that one is not familiar with can be a challenge, but we were so happy with our choice of this hotel. It is situated in an ideal location, very near museums, shopping, galleries, and excellent restaurants. Our room was spacious, attractive, and very comfortable. The reservations desk clerk was very helpful in accommodating our request for a quiet room on a high floor. All of the staff were very gracious and attentive. Evan, the concierege, was extremely knowledgeable and helpful in providing an overview of the city, suggestions on what to do, and excellent recommendations for restaurants. We wold definitely choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CherryMoon13
Reviews.Content: Number one most important thing is cleanliness! this hotel was spotless and even had a lovely aroma throughout the building. staff and concierge were extremely helpful and the location could not have been better. you are right next to the royal ontario museum and the bata shoe museum, the two highlights of our trip. The neighborhood is the nicest in toronto and just behind the hotel is the prettiest area in the city. do not miss the bloor-yorkville neighborhood with it's quaint little shops, great restaurants, and all around lovely scenery. Just a few blocks from the hotel, You Must Go To the MoRoCo Chocolate shop and restaurant.. hands down the most beautifully decorated eatery and the best chocolates in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OttoNYC
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental in Yorkville is like a hidden treasure. Right across the street from the ROM, around the corner (less than 1 block) from the St. George subway, located in the beautiful Yorkville neighborhood, we loved our stay. The room was clean and very large (two queen beds), four of us fit comfortably. But the real surprise was the staff. We travel a lot, and I can safely say I have never encountered a more consistently over-the-top friendly, helpful staff. Whether you need directions, spending money (!), or help with bags, the staff at the Intercontinental went out of their way to make us feel like we were the only customers they had to serve. We will definitely stay at this hotel on all subsequent visits.

Reviews.Title: “Right opposite the ROM”
Reviews.Author: TeignmouthRed
Reviews.Content: Nice place with great staff. Facilitated a late check-out which is always nice if there's a flight to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Family Celebration in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: reggob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along my mother, her friend and my wife's parents stayed at the Intercontinental Totonto Yorkville from the 1st June to the 7th June. We were in Toronto to celebrate my mothers birthday and my wife's parents wedding anniversay (both milestone nos.). From the moment we arrived to the time of our departure, our stay here was faultless. Check-in was smooth, efficient and friendly. In fact all Canadians that we met were very friendly and helpful. Our rate was inclusive of breakfast, which was table service in the restaurant and the morning ritual was of the highest standard....Boris was our waiter for the duration of our stay. We had drinks in the bar some evenings, again efficient and friendly service. The stars of the hotel are the Concierge team, Carolina and Evan. Prior to arriving in the hotel Carolina reserved all restaurants for the duration of our stay, she had some wonderful recommendations. We ate at Simple Bistro dinner, Osgoode Hall lunch, Spuntini dinner, 360 CN Tower dinner, C5 at the ROM dinner and Jamie Kennedy at the Gardner Museum lunch...all were excellent and very good value. While there Evan arranged the city tour and tour to Niagara Falls. The Niagara Falls tour was great and well worth it. Each day they enquired as to how we were getting on and how we liked/disliked the restaurants...really friendly and genuine people. The hotel is not huge like other IC's, has quite a boutique feel to it and the location is perfect, located near the museums and shopping is on the door step. It was my first trip to Canada and it is so different to their neighbour. Toronto may look like any North American city, but its citizens were more European and certainly not as brash as the USA folk. Our trip to Toronto was perfect and the IC Toronto Yorkville and its staff contributed in no small way to this perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5-star ...”
Reviews.Author: Pro-Flyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in trendy Yorkville near some nice shops, restaurants and the university campus. Travelling from/to Toronto's Pearson Airport by bus necessitates a cab from one of the stops for around 12 Canadian $ as the hotel is nowhere near the Airport Bus route. Reception was very friendly and super efficient. Deluxe king room had a good view over Tornoto and CN Tower. However, the bathroom had only one large towel. Not that one necessatily uses more than one towel, but the option in a 5-star hotel should be given. The hotel charges for in-room web access as well use of the Internet terminals in the on-site business centre. In addition 0800 and local calls are also being charged at a flatrate of $1.50 (Canadian). The overall feeling is that the hotel suffers severe budget constraints. This was also shown by the lack of bath foam and shower gel, only shampoo, conditioner and body lotion were provided. Weak aircon and only small window opening made the room feel stuffy. In short: OK hotel, but with the exception of the front desk desk staff nothing special and certainly not a true 5-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: museumgoer
Reviews.Content: Quietly elegant, first class in every way. Across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum, right in the midst of the best shopping and eating, and a pleasant walk through the University to the Art Gallery of Ontario. Helpful concierge. Elegant and tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Fstein
Reviews.Content: Although we booked with an online service and got a great price, when we checked in we requested a quiet room and were upgraded to a $650 (rack rate) superior room at no extra charge, as it was " more likely to be quiet". Staff very friendly and helpful. Location across from ROM and in midtown couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “This was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: druryperry
Reviews.Content: Our luggage didn't arrive at the airport but the hotel on our arrival, provided us with necessary amenities and answered our every request graciously. Terrific location, very comfortable and well-appointed rooms. Enjoyed the breakfast the next day. We'd definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Serene, clean Yorkville Oasis”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCT
Reviews.Content: The extreme cleanness and refreshing smell are the first things we noticed inside this hotel. A dramatic contrast to the mayhem of construction sites on both sides of the hotel, which were a detraction from the whole experience. Our room was well equipped, with superb bed and linens. Could have used more bathroom amenities, but separate shower and tub are always nice. No bathrobes, but Housekeeping immediately delivered two upon request. Disappointing that our room wasn't made up until late afternoon. Also, it's insulting that a supposed 5-star hotel has the nerve to charge $19.95 for internet access, which we all know means $19.95 extra profit for them. Lovely peaceful bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnLocation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights on vacation. Got a decent price on hotels.com. We liked the Yorkville location - across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum, easy subway access, many fine restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff was outstanding â€“ friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, professional. There is construction on both sides of the hotel and across the street, but we were given a room facing the back, and noise was not a problem. Yes, you do hear the subway rumbling underneath (even from our sixth floor room) but itâ€™s not terrible. The room was clean, had a comfortable king-sized bed, sitting area and desk. Nice modern dÃ©cor, but no up-to-the-minute flat panel TV. Bathroom was spacious, nicely appointed and very clean. We did not use the pool (which was closed for several days while we were there) or eat in the ground floor restaurant (always empty and therefore not too tempting). We had great meals in the neighborhood (Sotto Sotto, Belliniâ€™s, Bar Mercurio). Parking costs $35. per day, so after the first day, we parked it ourselves in the lot around the corner for less than $20. a day. Would recommend this hotel and gladly choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star Hotel - Clean with superb customer service”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveller33
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped in to when I left, this Hotel didn't stop exceeding my expectations. The staff (ALL of them) are trained and very experienced. They made me feel like I lived in the building. Ther'es always a doorman opening the door for us (even at 2am!!!). Everyone is smiling and very courteous and professional. I got a great deal using my AAA card, but the truth is, I would pay double the price for this hotel. The rooms are spacious, the bed is wonderful and the sheets are clean, crisp and smell great! The bathrooms have marble floors and come with a bathtub and a marble shower stall. The bathrooms are huge! I stayed here for 5 nights and six days and I will now stay here whenever I'm in town. It is a little out of the main downtown corridor, but still considered downtown. It's down the street from the high-end shops, i.e., Gucci, Cartier, Hermes, etc. and is in a great, safe and sophisticated part of town.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise for a U of T alumnus”
Reviews.Author: AstroElvis
Reviews.Content: When I was an undergraduate student at the University of Toronto, this block of Bloor Street was known as "Junk Food Strip", where one would look for burgers from Harveys, not fine food at a place like the InterContinental. I was impressed by every aspect of the hotel I encountered. The service, from the doorman and the reception staff to the bellman and the bartender, was thoughtful and efficient. The restaurant and room service served up very good food, with some nice twists on the usual hotel fare. The room was well appointed, spacious, with a perfect view of the skyline to the south and the ROM Crystal Gallery. The hotel is convenient to the TTC station across from the ROM, shopping in Yorkville and near Yonge and Bloor, and although Harveys is no longer down the street, lots of guilty pleasure junk food options are within a few minutes near Spadina and Bloor. The conference rooms are well laid out, and the catering service for our workshop was satisfying. I'll be staying at the InterContinental Yorkville again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere, good working environment, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sbuxbaum
Reviews.Content: I travel solo constantly for business and have to work for long hours in my hotel room from time to time. This hotel was perfectly located across the street from a great museum, within walking distance of lots of great little restaurants, and had rooms well laid out for working. Seemed easily as nice as a Four Seasons, without all the extra non sense, I was able to get lots of work done, take walks around the neighborhood to break up the day, find interesting places to eat and generally had a great time. Even got in a good workout and a swim in their indoor pool. You really couldn't be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MissHavana
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed by this hotel. I've stayed at many hotels in Toronto and this one is by far the best. Beautiful and spacious rooms, elegant decor, very very quiet for downtown Toronto. The hotel was situated right beside great shops, restaurants and nightlife. Loved my stay. Nothing will beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near subway too!”
Reviews.Author: K2C
Reviews.Content: All was well here. Location a big plus for those interested in Bata and Rom. Near the ttc subways too. Room are nice. The advertised newspaper to your room was never available, but apart from that all seemd well there. there is a small noise issue from underground sunway system, but didn't really bother us too mush, and our room was only on the 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and locaiton”
Reviews.Author: docfrompenetang
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to in Interconinential Hotel in Yorkville, Toronto in the last 6 months. What has been consistent each time has been the excellent service and prompt attention to detail with each stay. The location is ideal situated at the corner of Bloor and University Ave., right across the street from the 'Crystal' of the ROM. Carolina, the Congierge arranged lunch at the CN Tower and suggested a great restaurant for our pleasure. From the Valet, to the Doorman, to prompt check-in; all were done with the special attention that you get from a boutique hotel. It will remain my choice on my return to Toronto for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: museumtraveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived a few hours early ,and the front desk service was excellent. The porter was gracious and helpful, the desk person accommodated my request for a king sized bed and he was very polite. I am a regular hotwire user, and in some hotels, when you arrive and they know you hotwired, they are less than accommodating! The bed was lovely, the shower had great pressure, the room was nicely appointed and very quiet (ROM renovations are over). The location is the real gem.....across the street from the new Michael lee Chin Crystal at the ROM, mere moments from the best french fries in the country (JAmie Kennedy's restaurant at the Gardiner Museum), and a block from the posh shops of Bloor Street. To return to a friendly smile at the front desk without the attitude of some other hotels is truly lovely. I would recommend the Intercontinental to my friends, colleagues and family - in fact, I do!

Reviews.Title: “Profesional, clean, polite and awesome!”
Reviews.Author: packzz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel about 2 hours before check in time, as we wanted to spend the day downtown and did not want to pay for parking elsewhere, and pay for parking at the hotel... the hotel gave us no problems with this and checked us in immediately. The service was very profesional, they offered to help us with our bags, and the valet even opened the door of our vehicles or cabs when we arrived on site. The downfall would be the expensive parking you would expect. They charge $35.00 a day for vallet parking, or you can park your own vehicle down the street, around the block for $25.00 a day. The other thing I wasn't to happy with, was the fact the pool was very small, (15 meter lap pool), definitely not for kids. Other than that, the place was beautiful, very proffesional and polite. The valets did their job very well, and we were greeted by staff upon arrival. Definitely a hotel I would recommend for someone looking for something 'above and beyond' but keep in mind, all this great service, comes with a price...

Reviews.Title: “Light Sleepers Beware”
Reviews.Author: sarahalta
Reviews.Content: Overall I would give this hotel 3 out of 5 stars normally. The reason why I am giving it two stars is because both nights I had difficulty sleeping because I could hear the metro line which runs under the hotel. I am a VERY light sleeper, so if you are not a VERY light sleeper I doubt this will bother you. On the upside, I found the staff very helpful and they even moved us in hopes that the second room would be quieter the second night (it was slightly). The decor is pretty nice but maybe a bit tired in the two rooms we had on the fifth floor. In the first room a light bulb was burned out and the coffee machine was not restocked...but the second room had everything. I swam in the lap pool which was very nice. My husband is a heavy sleeper and he did not have as much of a problem with the metro, but did notice it. We loved the location because normally we stay more in the downtown core. This allowed us to see a different side of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Taipeiworldlywise
Reviews.Content: I actually went to the other Intercontinental thinking there was only one in Toronto. The other one is downtown. Quickly found out we went to the wrong one so cabbed over to the Yorkville one. While the first one was impressive as it was big, the Yorkville Intercontinental was better suited to my taste. It was lowkey and very classy. The check in staff was waiting for me as we had a really late check in. They were phenomenal. Then i walked into a room. They gave us one with a king sized bed. It was awesome! Bed: like sleeping on clouds Bathroom: very clean and good shampoo Location: near ROM and UofT and other shopping areas, close to metro so easy to get around. Pool: was closed but looks awesome Staff: very very accomodating I was fortunate to be assigned this hotel through hotwire so i paid nickels for the room. But would definitely go back and pay regular price. sure a step up from staying on friends' sofas.

Reviews.Title: “Problems, what problems?”
Reviews.Author: manofekent
Reviews.Content: Great location, decoration a little austere perhaps but the staff are friendly and helpful. Room only of average size, but it did have opening windows, always a bonus. You can always tell the true class of a hotel when something goes wrong, do they make it worse or do they make it go away? Because of a unique set of circumstances they misplaced the keys of our rental car. First we were treated to coffee, then lunch with the offer of a room if we needed it. They contacted the rental company, found at what they needed to do to return the car, accepted any additional charges, and when it was time to go to the airport whisked us there in a complimentary limo. There were only a couple of personal things in the car which they returned by mail. What could have been a disaster turned into a pleasant experience and a tale to tell. Good people.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissBigDee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel 3 nights. The staff was incredibly nice. The concierges (all three of them) were the best that I have ever dealt with, and I can be a demanding customer!! Very clean room. Large bathroom. Comfortable beds - fun turndown service. Cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. Great location for shopping and getting around for museums and restaurants. Don't be put off by the construction and the walk up to the hotel - no noise once you are inside, and you truly feel as though you are on a very thoughtful European vacation!! I would return and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinyPlanet08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for two nights. Very warm welcome from the doorman and a quick and easy check in. Loved the rooms, large and well appointed with a bed that I did not want to get out of. Bathroom was large with separate shower which is nice. If you go in the summer they have a really fantastic outdoor patio where we had drinks and a delicious seafood platter. Servers were relaxed and very friendly. Overall the best part of this hotel were the staff who are friendly and helpful. The concierge give me a great recommendation for a local sushi spot for lunch, and the doorman remembered me from check-in. I have stayed at other hotels in this area, but found the rooms and level of service here to be superior. Overall a great value and cozy hotel for the area.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok I think!”
Reviews.Author: xxxdarren
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in January2007 Hotel was very clean and staff was friendly, specially the 2 ladies at guest service desk.. We stayed in a room with 2 double beds,, from our window you could see the CN tower, Only down side was it, outside was so cold, like -6, as I come from Sunny Bolton, it never gets that cold, I don't think canada is for me.

Reviews.Title: “Expect no help in case of an emergency”
Reviews.Author: 1phillytraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel met all our expectations until our mother, who was traveling with us, had a stroke and was hospitalized. Initially we were told by the asst. manager, who was running the front desk, that we would be able to extend our stay until she was discharged. The next day when we returned from the hospital and found we were locked out of our rooms, the front office manager, Rolf Kenda, told us he didn't have room for us and we'd have to leave. When I asked if he could help us find another hotel, he gave no reply. I finally asked if we could have one room and share it; he responded yes, but for an additional $100/night! I wrote to corporate offices for Intercontinental in the beginning of July and still haven't received an answer!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the rating”
Reviews.Author: bbbradk
Reviews.Content: A group on friends were going on a boat cruise in Lake Ontario and I suggested we try and book a few rooms downtown so there would be no rush to get home after the cruise. I found the Intercontinental through Hotwire, they had it rated as a four and a half star hotel, I would call them a four star at best. The hotel is in a great area, and although rather small in relation to most of the hotels in the neighborhood it was nice. From the front it's a very unassuming place (I am in that area regularly and I've never noticed it) but once you walk into the lobby it is set up nicely. Check in was quick (I had reserved a room for 4, and they tried offering me a room with 1 king size bed)(something that they tried with several members of our group. The interior of the hotel is nice, but seems small. Once we got to the room we thought it was nice (in my mind a four and a half star hotel should wow you, this was just an ok room) A few things I noticed that enforced my belief in a lowered rating. Toilet paper was cheap, seemed like 1 ply. No fan in the bathroom Small television (the room held 2 beds, and was quote large but there was only a '27 tv. On button on television was stuck in the on position. Cheap clock radio (most higher end places will provide more than a $5.00 model). In all I don't have any real criticysms other than petty things that I thought made this less than a four and a half star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: lextravels
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We were upgraded to a junior suite - very comfortable. We booked the Royal Ontario Museum package that included a wonderful breakfast (we used room service) and parking as well as ROM tickets. This hotel is right across the street from ROM and in the heart of shopping and restaurants of Yorkville. A wonderful location. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. We liked everything!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from a not so great experience”
Reviews.Author: deemc99
Reviews.Content: We decided on a last minute trip and called for availability. The least inexpensive room was a studio suite at approx $400 the first night and $284 the second. A bit more than we wanted to spend, but after reading the great reviews, figured what the heck! I had requested an early checkin which was not guaranteed, but was assured the latest the room would be ready is 3 p.m. - we arrived at 3:45 pm and was told the room was not ready yet. The front desk gentleman was kind enough to upgrade us to an executive suite, but it only had a king bed rather than 2 queen. We figured we could manage and at least we could go clean up right away. Got into the room and thought it was very nice - until my 10 year old daughter found a condom on the couch. Thank goodness it hadn't been opened. The bathroom was also dirty. Called down to the front desk and they asked us to hold on for a moment. The Manager got on the phone, apologized profusely and notified me we were being upgraded to the Penthouse Suite. Was thrilled with how accomodating this place was - so we met her at the elevator and proceeded up to the top floor. Although the room was okay, it was not what I envisioned for a penthouse suite that goes for $1600 a night- carpet was fraying all over, rooms looked outdated. Again, the bathroom was dirty, but this time I just cleaned the toilet myself. Then, I pulled the comforter back and found a blood stain on the sheet. Yuck! Called back down and of course, they sent housekeeping which changed only that sheet rather than remake the whole bed. The Manager did send us dessert and vouchers for breakfast - so again, very apologetic and tried to make things right. Next day we went out fairly early and returned about 12 pm. Was surprised that the "service room" sign was gone and that housekeeping had come already. Walked in and found all of our breakfast plates and such still on the dining room table, but the bed had been made. Then the final straw - the housekeeper had must of been hungry because she ate some of our leftover breakfast. I could not believe it and decided I really did not want to stay any longer. We were granted our request to cancel our 2nd night without penaly, but will definitely not return to this hotel. Matter of fact, I don't think we will return to Toronto - not at all what we remembered from years gone by.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amyuga06
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Toronto with family for roughly five days, and we needed a nice hotel in an interesting location. I found an incredibly low rate on Hotwire for the Intercontinental, and we paid roughly half of the original room rate. Honestly, it's one of the better deals I've ever received for the quality of the room and the price. The Intercontinental - Yorkville is in a nice part of town, just across the street from the music conservatory and another block or two from the University of Toronto. Also, it's a block or two from the Shoe Museum, which is a Must See. Although we were just a few floors up from the street, our hotel room was quiet at night. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. If you can snare a low rate for this hotel through Hotwire, it's really a great bargain. We would absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Pullman1
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel located right on the border between the section of Bloor Street defined by high fashion and that defined by the University of Toronto. It is within easy walking distance of both districts -- and only a block or two from the St. George station on Toronto's user-friendly subway system. The staff simply couldn't be kinder or more helpful. This is especially true of the concierges, Carolina and Evan. They helped us with everything from local travel to restaurants and shopping, and their advice was unfailingly on target. Invest some time on the concierge web site -- both the one on the main hotel page and the more detailed one that comes with the email confirmation of your reservation a few days before arrival. These are terrific guides to the city. The lobby of the hotel is modest, but the rooms are both large and very comfortable. They are also remarkably quiet: no noise either from outside or from your neighbors. We ate dinner one night in the outdoor cafe, which features tapas and a vast selection of drinks. It was both stylish and relaxed, and the food was remarkably good. Breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was included in our rate, and we heartily recommend it. Wonderful fresh orange juice and world-class coffee. The granola was the best I've ever had, and others praised their eggs and pastries. Here, again, the service was both attentive and friendly. This is a great place to base yourself for anything except a heavy-duty mission in the financial district. The neighborhood is a delight, with a wonderful cluster of restaurants, shops, night spots, museums, and coffee houses. Our party of four had absolutely no reservations. This is a terrific place, cheaper and less pretentious than the nearby Four Seasons and Hyatt, but every bit as good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Very $$$, Watch for the Construction.”
Reviews.Author: brightsun1
Reviews.Content: Well, we wanted to divert our trip to show our kids Toronto. Had a nice rate (relatively speaking) for the IC, and read good reviews of the property. It is a relatively unassuming property. Well located. Staff was nice, rooms were excellent. We were there on a weekend, and, looking out of our room was a huge construction site and a crane about 30 stories up. During the week, this could be an issue for you. As our dollar is now about worth a peso, the price of everything was about 2 to 3 x a US property. We came, we saw, we left. Staff was nice and the hotel was lovely. I would call and check about the construction before I'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janiel
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hotel. Lots of marble, very nice staff and very clean. It is a little bit away from Toronto and you would need a car. I would stay here again and although I'm probably the only person not to like Delta Chelsea in the city centre ( we must have got the cheap rooms) I wished we'd booked in here again on our return back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a wow! Staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable”
Reviews.Author: normafor
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a night at the Intercontinental Yorkville Hotel in Toronto. The hotel is beautiful and the service was fabulous. The room was very clean and was well laid out. A nice touch was the bay windows that opened. The beds were very comfortable, and instead of the standard questionable bedspread, we had a duvet with freshly laundered cover. All requests, from extra bathrobes to towels to taxis, were dealt with immediately and graciously. The bathroom had lots of little extras, such as high end shampoo and moisturizers, q-tips and an extra razor. It felt more like staying in a wonderful guest house than a big hotel. We had an after-theatre drink at the hotel bar, and were again impressed by the atmosphere and service. The hotel is well located, and was within easy walking distance of some of the best shopping and cultural venues in Toronto. Overall I would say this is one of the best hotels I have visited, and I'll certainly be back. Norma

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in November. From the outside I wasn't sure what to expect, but the interior is very nice, rooms are very modern with very comortable beds. Yorkville is probably the nicest area to stay in Toronto, although it is not close to downtown. The University and the ROM are across the street, as well as major shopping down the street, such as Pottery Barn, Holt Renfrew, Lululemon, and all the upscale shops. Eatery wise, we liked the VIetnamese that was upstairs next door. I would stay here again when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in nearly a dozen downtown Toronto hotels and this is in the top 3!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I am in Toronto every month, and have stayed at so many hotels that my mind is getting fuzzy as to which ones I liked the best. But, I can say with confidence that this hotel is one my favourites. Rooms: - Very comfortable, clean and quiet. The amenities were great (a shower and a bathtub, a wonderful bed where the duvet cover is clearly changed after each guest, great tv, internet access). - So quiet: I didn't hear neighbours and only moderate amounts of "outside the room" noise. I am a very light sleeper and this is so often an issue for me Hotel Services: - Room service was great. I have a few allergies, and their attention to that was fantastic. The service was friendly and the food was good. My only complaint, and this is across the board for Toronto hotels (except the one by the Skydome) is the delivery charge + 18% gratuity! I don't mind paying a delivery fee but I would like to be able to judge whether the gratuity is earned or not!! - The workout facilities are adequate. There are several cardio machines, weights, and a few weight machines. There isn't much space for those of us that like to do free weights and ab exercises, but it also was never busy so I can't complain about that. The pool and hot tub were also on the top floor with the workout area but I didn't use them. - Laundry/Dry Cleaning: I had to use these services and they actually had three choices: rush (for one hour or so), same day and overnight! I left them some things in the morning and when I arrived that night the items that needed pressing were pressed and the dry cleaned items were cleaned. Great!! And the price was only about 25% more than I would have paid at home. Location: - It's just around the corner from St. George subway station which is great Subway station... easy access to both the North/South line and the East/West line so whether you are heading downtown or out to the Danforth you are just seconds away from easy transportation - It's in Yorkville! So if good food, shopping and the best spa's in Toronto (Stillwater) are on your agenda you can't go wrong. Park your car and never need it! My only comment for improvement to the hotel is that their restaurant doesn't open until 7am for breakfast. For the business traveler this is too late! I typically will eat my breakfast around 6:45am and head to a meeting at 7:30am. I ended up going across the street to Tim Hortons (which is NOT my first choice).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinsquirrel
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Yorkville exceeded all of our expectations. We went to Toronto for a little food & wine, shopping, and a ball game. The hotel was a complete bonus. The rooms were very clean, the hotel staff was quite charming, the beds were quite comfortable, and I could not have asked for a hotel in a better location. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: I don't think this hotel lives up to the rave reviews I've read. Its nice. Very clean and rooms are well appointed. However, from the outside, it looks like a run down Howard Johnson's and is on the edge of the "nice" part of the city. Front staff was nice enough and conceriege was very helpful. However, based on the reviews, I thought I was going staying at some real top notch hotel. This one will not leave an impression. However, the IC at Toronto Centre did make a big impression on me during my last visit so I will likely go back there for my next stay in this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: cclemens31
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the better hotels I've stayed in. Has great facilities and awesome service. The front desk workers were very nice and willing to provide answers to any questions about Toronto, how to get around etc... The room was clean and spacious with very comfortable beds. The only drawback that at around 3am there was a party going on down the hall. The walls of the hotel are so solid that I could barely hear it. This hotel is right next to a University so this isn't entirely unexpected. Overall it was a good experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: hoteluser
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee booked us one night at the Intercontinental for my birthday. The service she got for this special occasion was terrific. After calling ahead to tell the hotel what she had in store the rest of the day, the hotel seemed happy to accomodate her. In particular thanks go to Jeff, who had helped her book the room and on our day of arrival told us that he had been waiting for us. On arrival, we got a free room upgrade. Once in the room, there was a small complimentary box of special truffles with a dedicated note from the service manager to enjoy our stay. Not only that, but the front desk followed up to make sure we liked the room and everything was appropriate. For those of you who like to swim, there may be better locations. The shallow lane pool suited us just fine however, and there is a nice outdoor terrace attached to the pool with contemporary furniture. Overall, a very pleasant stay and great service, especially given that we only stayed one night. I will definitely keep this hotel in mind in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First Class - Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: EMMParis
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in. For someone who spends on average 60-70 nights a year in a hotel, I get to see excellent, good and really bad for the buck hotels. First time in the IC Yorkville, and it is amazing. The deluxe room was lovely: the furniture is lovely and new, the bed extremely comfortable, the sheets are special (it is not only a marketing touch for their website hehe). Everything worked in the room, the bathroom, carpet, sheets, comforter: SPOTLESS. I felt at home. I am a germaphobe and I care a lot about cleanliness. Absolutely no complaints. The service is excellent, professional, helpful but not overbearing like at some other high class hotels where being nice has become being a 'friend.' The people at IC know their job: they wanna help you and give you a very comfortable stay. The lobby and the bar are lovely, and of course the room amenities are first class. For 300 CAD (tax included) per night, it is worth it. At least you get first class service and what you pay for. Would definitely stay there again, it is one of the best and hope they keep their standards.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb! Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: Getting a great rate on Hotwire - we chose this hotel for our stay in Toronto and a day trip to Niagra Falls. We did not regret it for a second. The room we had was wonderfully appointed, the concierge service suburg, and the hotel located in a nice part of the city. I would chose this location over the other downtown location 10 times out of 10. You are not necessarily superclose to Skydome, Ontario Place, CN Tower, and other attractions but close to the Royal Ontario Museum and public transportation is excellent. And again, the concierge service was simply suburb. We tipped the man who bent over backwards to help us $40 when we left. Stay here with confidence. It's a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in nice part of town”
Reviews.Author: HayRan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for 8 nights on a vacation to Toronto. It was a fabulous hotel in a great location. It was clean, the staff was pleasant and the hotel was quiet. The only negative thing I can say is that on one of the nights, the fire alarm started going off at 2 in the morning. The staff informed us through the intercom that we should be on standby while they checked it out. After a few minutes, they came back on the intercom and notified everyone that it was a false alarm. Had this happened during the day, I would not even waste my time mentioning it but the fact that it happened at 2am was an extreme disturbance. The next morning, we had a letter from the hotel manager apologizing for the inconvenience. Other than this incident, our stay was very comfortable. The beds are one of the best I've had and turn down service was nice. During our 8 days, we walked everywhere and must have walked up and down Bloor Street about 20 times because of all the fabulous shopping to be had. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant because you can walk outside the door and find so many other affordable choices. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A very UNDER-rated Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Lainx
Reviews.Content: This has to the most underrated hotel in Toronto, period. Although it can be pretty difficult to get to because of all of the construction across the street at the museum. The doorman was walked greeted me before I could even get out of my car. He was more than helpful. Then when I entered the hotel, the people at the check-in were also helpful. The only negative thing about my whole experience was the parking. The parking is around the block and actually comes around behind the hotel. I think we had to pay about $25 a night. But it is a big city. I won't say how much I've paid in NYC. However the elevator from the lot to the hotel were out of order and I had to carry my bags up two flights of narrow stairs. Besides that, I loved this hotel. First off, it has probably the best fitness area I've ever seen in a hotel. There's a suana and a steam room in the men's locker room. I've never seen a steam room in a hotel. The equipment in the gym area was pretty nice also; treadmills, free weights, and Nautilus machines. There's also a really narrow pool adjacent to the weight room. The rooms were pretty small but that's what you can expect from any major city hotel room. Nice bedding, nice size TV, really nice bathroom; seperate shower and tub. I really enjoyed the hotel which is right in Toronto's SoHo district. It's only two blocks from the subway and two stops from the Eaton Centre where everybody is. I'd definitely recommend to anyone that wants a nice quiet hotel in Downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bailey2004
