Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights August 15-17. After reviewing all the hotels and reviews, I was having serious decision problems. I ended up booking through hotwire at a great rate. Great location! in terms of subway, traffic and a ten minute walk to the Annex which has numerous restuarants, bars and shops. Yes, it is a couple of miles to the CN tower and the harborfront, but with tourist season in full swing, do you really want to stay down there anyway? We walked down there and took the clean and easily marked public trans back to our hotel. We had a courtyard room. Yes, the hotel is traditional, but with nice touches like the robes, separate tub and shower, windows that open, etc. We definitely slept well there. Avoid the Skyy Lounge...great furniture, good drinks, awful service. Over Easy, which was mentioned in another review was great for breakfast. There is also a money exchange place a couple of doors down. Ballard ballroom, which is traditionally a college bar had great service at the bar for a few drinks. Our bartender was giving us samples of the brews before we decided on which one to drink. If you like Sushi, go to Sushi time. Nothing fancy, but good food, reasonable and cold Sapporo's. Avoid Tim Hortons and visit the Reagle Beagle on Bloor(yes, the same name as the bar on Three's Company) cold beer and good service. Visit Casa Loma, the shoe museum and go the Steamwhistle Brewery at the Harborfront for samples and a tour of their microbrewery...awesome and enlightening! PS...If you take the ferry from Rochester, it is around 16 dollars (CAN) cab ride each way to the hotel. You do not need a car in Toronto. Great city and noticeably clean!

Reviews.Title: “Everything a 4+* Hotel Should Be”
Reviews.Author: Delmarvin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend earlier this month. And what a lovely place it is! We'd booked a package through the Toronto Tourism site run by the Toronto CVB, which promised us a "superior" (aka standard) room. When we arrived, we didn't even have to ask the hotel about upgrading us - they'd already done that. Our room on the 6th floor (it's an 8-story building) was perfect, spacious and nicely decorated. It faced the inner courtyard, not the street, so it was very quiet. Bed was terrific - firm but forgiving mattress, crisp linens - really comfortable. Air conditioning worked well, and the thermostat displays temps in C and F. The bay window opened for fresh air. The bathroom was large and clad in marble. Wouldn't mind having one of these at home. The marble shower was little cramped, but no real complaint. The hotel's service was top-notch. Check-in was quick, efficient and done with a smile and a "Welcome." The concierges know everything about Toronto and were most helpful. Once when I called for some information, they answered the phone "How may I assist you Mr. (my name)?" Nice use of Caller ID. :) The turn-down service each night, with dimmed lights and classical music on the CD/radio, was classy! The hotel's Yorkville location is the best. It was an easy walk to great little restaurants and pubs and trendy lounges. With a subway station right around the corner, getting around Toronto was a breeze. Indeed, I parked the car when we arrived and never saw it again until we left three days later. And yes, I used the city-run self-park around the corner on Bedford Street. The previous reviews were right on the mark: rates are half what the hotel charges, and the garage elevator takes you right into the Interconti's lobby. The only negative that I can think of is the in-room coffee: it's $4.95 per, which I didn't know until we checked out and found the charge on our bill. Oh well. Also, while the rooftop pool was nice, I wished the hotel had a whirlpool for those of us who prefer soaking to swimming laps. All in all, this ranks as one of the loveliest places my wife and I have ever stayed. No question that this is where we'll stay whenever we return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster. Extremely poor reservation service.”
Reviews.Author: infocus
Reviews.Content: I booked a group of friends at the InterContinental Toronto on Bloor Street after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. My group and I were not impressed. First, I found by calling the Hotel three days before the trip that our reservations sans one room had all been cancelled. This even after guarenteeing them via American Express three months prior. After apologies and being reassured the reservations were reinstated, we arrived to two out of the four rooms with one bed each causing four grown men to share two beds for an evening. More apologies and told that the problem may not be able to be fixed due to a full occupancy. After much insistance, we were granted the correct arrangements. Also, the "Ambassador Club" (which I joined when I reserved the rooms) ammenities were not delivered. I had to call the front desk (who apologized for the mix-up) to make good. Added to that, the baggage handler lost my "exclusive" Ambassador luggage tag. Upon checkout, the bill was incorrect. After much discussion with the assistant manager, I was assured it would be corrected. That remains to be seen. Stay tuned. The hotel was clean, fantasic concierge, the staff friendly however, this was not the luxury hotel I thought I was getting. The bed was lumpy. The decor, dull. The furntiure, very ordinary. Not horrible however, I would recommend you check other Hotels in the price range.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Intercontinental was Great!”
Reviews.Author: DaphneG
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Hotel Intercontinental Toronto and thoroughly enjoyed the trip. We travel with our dog and the hotel and staff were most accommodating to her, making us all feel welcome. The hotel is right across from the University of Toronto; while there was some construction going on, we were still able to cross Bloor and take her on to the campus for long walks. Additionally, there are nice neighborhoods behind the hotel to walk in, and a small city park within a block. This worked out great. Only down sides: if you travel with a pet they tack on a 50.00 additionally charge "clean up fee" for the pet (rather ridiculous in our case, but worth it to be able to have the dog with us) AND they put us in a smoking room on the third floor. I am a little sensitive to cigararette smoke but we were able to clear out any lingering odor easily with the AC (and -- I love this -- you are in a hotel room where you can actually open the window -- how wonderful this is!) The room was large and bathroom REALLY large, with separate shower and tub, marble flooring. Bed very comfy and a true king, which we were promised. We did not get the duvet which they make much of in the advertisement for the room, but bed covers all in good shape. Everything very clean in our case. If traveling with your pet, be aware they have a 50 lb. limit but on a call to confirm they seemed a little hesitant as to what their policy actually was. Be sure to confirm. The hotel itself is not that impressive from the exterior, but don't be put off. The interior, from the lobby on, is beautiful. The lobby itself has beautiful marble flooring, and the Harmony Lounge and Signatures restaurant are beautiful and immaculate. There is also a cute Sky Lounge in the courtyard of the building -- nice tables and lounge furniture to either dine at or just have drinks. Had the best drink I've ever had there -- the raspberry mojito. We didn't find the drink prices out of line for an upscale sort of place. Service throughout -- from check in to concierge, bell men, bartenders -- all excellent -- friendly and nice. Breakfast was included in our rate -- and it was very good. You can order off menu in the restaurant (or eat in your room, from what I understand) and it was delicously prepared and beautifully presented. An excellent value. Bloor Street was a little busy for my tastes, but if you duck into the neighborhoods of Yorkville behind things quiet right down. We did not use the self park option behind the hotel as other reviewers had -- we were afraid our Tahoe was too tall to pass below the gates. We shelled out the 30.00 per night for parking, which we could have done without but couldn't see much of an option. Excellent restaurants in the area, many with outdoor dining (most let you bring your dog with you!) I found Toronto to be MUCH more dog-friendly than Chicago, which we visited in May. Dogs seem to be allowed on every mode of public transit, space allowing -- we took our girl on the double decker bus, the trolley, and the subway. We also went on a fun schooner sail in the harbor which was a great way to see the city waterfront. Can't wait to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Flaesb
Reviews.Content: After a few reservation mishaps, my stay at the IC Toronto could not have been better. Large luxurious room, perfect location on one of the best streets in town. Staff was helpful and accomodating. Breakfast was included at $167/night (USD) which was delicious and plentiful. I would highly recommend this hotel for visitors to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great hotel...within easy walking distance to shopping, metro, restuarants, university of toronto. concierge and staff all friendly and helpfull. don't forget to ask for the aaa rate. i would definitely stay here again. we self parked and walked everywhere or used the metro. a family pass for 2 adults 2 children for 24 hours unlimited use was just 8 dollars. very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Spot”
Reviews.Author: Pudding33
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here just for one night. It was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. I've been to 4 star hotels, westin, hilton, sheraton, and nothing comes close. This hotel had many little perks that were so nice - books for reading in the room, big bathrobe, seperate bath and shower, dark oak front door, glass chess table to name a few. My boyfriend and I had the pool to ourselves and we went there 3 times. It was in indoor roof top pool, and had a roof top patio. Perfect hotel for couples

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkpemay
Reviews.Content: Took a girls weekend here with 4 girls and 2 rooms. We paid $188 CAD. I switched from the Sheraton Toronto Centre because I had heard bad reviews the few weeks before we left, and we made a great decision in switching to the Intercontinental. We really had a great stay, and it was cheaper than the Sheraton too. One thing I was worried about was getting 2 double beds in each room because apparently most of the rooms here have king beds. I called beforehand and requested this, and even though they told me on the phone that only 1 room with 2 doubles was available, we did get both rooms with 2 doubles upon check in, as well as our request to have the rooms close together. The rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. No complaints, except they do charge for the coffee to be used in the in-room coffeemaker. The hotel is in a great location, lots of shops and restaurants, and we easily took the subway to Casa Loma and downtown sightseeing locations. Really fun trip and nice hotel.
